Original Story: Lily was a naughty girl. She liked to make a mess and break things. She did not listen to her mom or dad. One day, she found a big pair of scissors in the drawer. She decided to play with them. She cut her hair, her clothes, and her doll's hair. She made a big pile of scraps on the floor.Mom came home and saw the mess. She was very angry. She shouted at Lily. "What did you do? You ruined your hair and your clothes and your doll! You are a very naughty girl! I have to punish you for this!"Lily was scared. She did not like to be punished. She said, "I'm sorry, mom. I just wanted to try a new style. I thought it would be fun."Mom did not believe her. She said, "You are not sorry. You are lying. You did not try a new style. You just made a disaster. You have to go to your room and stay there. No TV, no toys, no snacks. And tomorrow, you have to go to the hairdresser and get a very short haircut. Maybe then you will learn your lesson."Lily cried. She did not want to go to her room. She did not want to lose her TV, her toys, and her snacks. She did not want to get a very short haircut. She wished she had not played with the scissors. But it was too late. She had been a naughty girl, and now she had to face the consequences.
Original Summary: Lily, a mischievous girl, caused chaos by cutting her own hair, clothes, and dolls' hair with scissors, resulting in her mother's anger and punishment.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a big, brown bear. He loved to hop around in the forest. One day, he was feeling very hot and thirsty. He looked for some water to drink, but he couldn't find any. So, he decided to take a nap under a tree. While he was sleeping, some rabbits came hopping by. They saw the big bear and were scared. But then, they noticed he was sleeping and didn't seem so scary anymore. One of the rabbits was brave enough to hop up to the bear and touch his nose. The bear woke up and saw the little rabbit. He wasn't mad, he was happy to make a new friend. The bear and the rabbits played together and hopped around the forest. They had so much fun that the bear forgot all about being hot and thirsty. From that day on, the bear and the rabbits were the best of friends and hopped around together every day. The end.
Original Summary: A big, brown bear in a forest hopped around and made friends with some rabbits after they initially feared him while he was sleeping.

Original Story: Once there was a small girl called Lucy who loved avocados. Every day, she would pick one from the tree in her garden and eat it with her lunch.One day, when she was in her garden, a small creature disturbed her. It had green skin, just like the avocado that Lucy loved! She reached out and grabbed it.The creature let out a loud screech and Lucy's dad ran out to see what was happening. He screamed at Lucy when he saw the creature in her hands."Put that creature down!" He said. Lucy could tell he was angry but she wasn't sure why. Dad explained that the creature was an endangered animal and she had to put it down straight away. She put it back on the ground, carefully.The creature crept away and disappeared into the garden. Lucy felt a little sad and dull. From then on, she only picked avocados with her dad's permission and left the animals in the garden alone.
Original Summary: A young girl named Lucy loved eating avocados from her garden, but when a small green creature with skin like an avocado appeared in her garden, her father forbade her from touching it, explaining it was an endangered species and she had to release it back into the garden, leaving Lucy feeling sad and subdued.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there were two friends. One was a bean and the other was a number. The bean was clean, and the number was clean too.The number and the bean played together all day long. They laughed and ran around the garden. The number could run faster than the bean so the bean had to catch up all the time.They kept on playing until the sun started to go down. Then the bean said goodbye to number and got ready for bed. But before the bean went to sleep, it gave the number a big hug. The bean hugged number so tight that it said a special magic spell - and suddenly the number started to turn into a bean too! Number was very glad and thanked the bean for the magic. They both laughed and hugged again and said goodnight.And ever since that day, the bean and number were the best of friends, playing together all day and night, always happy and clean!
Original Summary: Two friends, a bean and a number, played together all day long in a garden until the sun set, with the bean using a magic spell to turn the number into a bean as well, making them the best of friends.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and get dirty. He would run around in the mud and play with his toys. One day, Timmy's mom asked him to come inside and clean up. Timmy didn't want to stop playing, but he knew he had to listen to his mom. So, he surrendered and went inside. He took a bath and put on his clean clothes. After he was all clean, Timmy wanted to go back outside and play. But before he could go, his mom asked him to sign a piece of paper. Timmy didn't know what signing meant, but his mom explained that it meant he was agreeing to something. Timmy signed the paper and went outside to play. He had so much fun, but he made sure to stay clean this time so he wouldn't have to surrender and go inside again.
Original Summary: Timmy, a mischievous little boy, is asked by his mom to clean up and sign a paper, but he wants to keep playing and learns the importance of listening to his mom.

He knew he had to help. With a spring in his step, Benny used his strong legs to push the tree away. Everyone was safe and happy. Benny felt proud of himself and his medal sparkled in the sun.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to visit her friend's house to play with their dog. One day, Lily went to visit her friend and play with the dog. But when she got there, she felt uncomfortable because the dog was barking too much.Lily's friend said, "Don't worry, the dog is just excited to see you! He really likes you." Lily felt a little better and decided to play with the dog anyway. She threw a ball and the dog ran to fetch it. Lily laughed and petted the dog's soft fur.After a while, Lily said goodbye to her friend and the dog. She promised to visit again soon and play with the dog some more. The dog barked happily as she left, and Lily felt happy too. She realized that even though the dog made her uncomfortable at first, she still had a lot of fun playing with him.
Original Summary: Lily visited her friend's house to play with their dog, but initially felt uncomfortable due to the dog's excessive barking. However, her friend reassured her, and they played together, with Lily laughing and petting the dog, before saying goodbye and promising to visit again.

Original Story: John saw an old man shivering in the winter cold. He didn't have a warm coat to wear. John asked the old man:"Are you okay? Why don't you have a warm coat?" The old man replied:"I used to fix things and make them new again, but I can't fix this cold winter".John felt very sorry for the old man and remembered his dad's tool box in the garage. He ran back home and brought out his dad's tool box. John opened the tool box and found a warm coat inside. He ran back to the old man and gave him the coat. The old man was so glad and thanked John many times for his kindness. John's dad said: "That was a very nice of you, John. But remember, there are many things in life that we can't fix, but being kind and helping whenwe can will always make things better".John realized that being kind to others is the most important thing he can do, no matter the situation.  He was very glad that he was able to help the old man.
Original Summary: John found an old man shivering in the cold and gave him his father's warm coat after realizing that kindness is the most important thing he can do, regardless of the situation.

Original Story: Once, there was a sleepy girl who had a special bracelet. The bracelet was silver and sparkled in the sunlight. Every day the girl wore her bracelet so it wouldn't slip away. One day, the girl was very sleepy. She was so sleepy she couldn't keep her eyes open. As she was walking, the bracelet began to slip from her wrist. Her hand got heavy and the bracelet slowly fell onto the ground.The girl didn't notice and kept walking until her mom called her. When the mom saw the bracelet on the ground, she quickly picked it up and put it back on the girl's wrist. The girl was so relieved because she was afraid it was gone forever.The girl thanked her mom and promised to stop getting so sleepy. From then on, the girl made sure her bracelet never slipped away.
Original Summary: A sleepy girl wore a sparkling silver bracelet every day, but one day it slipped off her wrist as she walked and nearly fell away, prompting her mother to quickly retrieve it and put it back on her wrist, saving the girl from losing it forever.

Original Story: Sara and Tom are friends. They like to play with toys and draw pictures. One day, they find a big box of crayons. They want to make a beautiful picture together.Sara picks a purple crayon. She likes purple. It is her favorite color. She draws a big purple flower on the paper. She smiles.Tom picks a red crayon. He likes red. It is his favorite color. He draws a big red dragon on the paper. He roars.Sara looks at Tom's dragon. She is scared. She thinks the dragon is fierce. She does not like fierce things. She says, "Tom, why did you draw a fierce dragon? It is scary. It can eat my flower."Tom looks at Sara's flower. He is bored. He thinks the flower is dull. He does not like dull things. He says, "Sara, why did you draw a dull flower? It is boring. It cannot do anything."Sara and Tom are sad. They do not like each other's pictures. They do not want to play together. They sit on opposite sides of the paper. They are quiet.Then, they hear a voice. It is their teacher, Miss Lee. She comes to see their picture. She smiles. She says, "Wow, Sara and Tom, what a wonderful picture! You have used two different colors and two different things. You have made a contrast. A contrast is when two things are very different, but they make each other more interesting. I like your purple flower and your red dragon. They are both beautiful in their own way."Sara and Tom look at their teacher. They look at their picture. They look at each other. They are surprised. They did not know they made a contrast. They did not know their picture was interesting. They did not know their teacher liked it.They decide to discuss their picture with their teacher. They ask her questions. They tell her why they chose their colors and their things. They listen to her answers. They learn new words. They learn new ideas. They learn to appreciate their differences.They are happy. They thank their teacher. They hug each other. They say, "We are friends. We like to play with toys and draw pictures. We like to make contrasts. We like purple and red. We like flowers and dragons. We like dull and fierce."
Original Summary: Sara and Tom, two friends who like to play with toys and draw pictures, find a big box of crayons and create a picture together, but they don't like each other's creations, leading to a discussion with their teacher, Miss Lee, who explains the concept of contrast and how their different choices made their picture interesting, and they learn to appreciate their differences and become happier.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a fine volcano. Every day the volcano would make bright lights and loud noise. It was so exciting! One day, a little girl named Daisy decided to climb the volcano. She was very brave. As Daisy reached the top she saw the volcano had something special! There were tears of beautiful colour trickling down the side.Daisy excitedly clapped her hands and jumped around the volcano. She had never seen anything like it. She reached out to touch the tears and her hand lit up with bright colours. Daisy was in awe of what she could see. She felt so happy.The tears from the volcano shined in the sunlight. Daisy laughed and cried at the same time. She was filled with joy and quickly ran all the way back down the volcano. She told everyone about the fine volcano and the wonderful tears it had made. From then on, Daisy and her friends always made sure to visit the volcano to witness the special tears it made.
Original Summary: A little girl named Daisy climbed a volcano and was amazed by the bright lights and loud noises it made, as well as the tears of colorful light that flowed down its side, which she was able to touch and experience great joy and happiness.

Original Story: "Billy was so excited to go camping with his family. He saw the bright stars in the night sky, heard the crickets chirping, and couldn't wait to explore the woods. As he got closer to the camp site, Billy noticed a mouse scurrying around. He started to complain that the mouse was scary, but his family thought it was cute. Billy made his way to the campfire to roast marshmallows, and he forgot all about the mouse. That is until the mouse appeared out of nowhere and scurried right past him! He screamed and ran away, but the mouse kept chasing him. No matter how much Billy ran, the mouse kept coming after him. Eventually, the mouse ran right into Billy's tent. Billy was so scared, he had to sleep with his parents that night! The next morning, the family packed their things, said goodbye to the camp site, and headed home. Billy was glad to be out of the woods, and he vowed never to go camping again!"
Original Summary: Billy was terrified of a mouse that chased him during a camping trip, causing him to run away and sleep in his parents' tent, and the family eventually left the campsite the next morning.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to hear stories from her grandma. One day, she asked her grandma to tell her a story. When the rabbit woke up, he saw the turtle had already won the race."Lily laughed and said, "That's a funny joke, grandma!"Grandma smiled and said, "It's not a joke, it's a story. But I'm glad you liked it."

Original Story: Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play soccer in the park. Lily has a new ball. It is red and shiny. Ben wants to play with it too."Can I play with your ball?" Ben asks Lily."OK, we can share," Lily says. She is a good friend. She kicks the ball to Ben.Ben and Lily take turns to kick the ball. They try to score a goal. They have fun. But then a big dog comes. It is black and thick. It runs to the ball. It grabs the ball with its teeth. It runs away."Hey, that's our ball!" Lily shouts. She and Ben chase the dog. They want their ball back.The dog is fast. It runs to a fence. It jumps over the fence. Lily and Ben cannot jump over the fence. They are sad. They lost their ball."Sorry, Lily," Ben says. "It was your new ball.""It's OK, Ben," Lily says. "It was not your fault. The dog was bad. Maybe we can find another ball."Lily and Ben hug. They are still friends. They go to look for another ball. They hope to share and score again.

Original Story: Anna loved peaches. She liked how they were soft and sweet and juicy. She liked how they smelled like summer. She liked how they had a little pit inside that she could spit out.One day, Anna went to the market with her mom. She saw a big basket of peaches at a stall. She ran to the basket and picked up a peach. She looked at it with big eyes. She wanted to eat it right away."Mom, can I have this peach?" she asked."Of course, honey. But first, we have to pay the man who sells the peaches. He is very generous. He gives us a good price and sometimes he gives us an extra peach for free. He works hard to grow the peaches and bring them here. We have to say thank you and be polite," her mom said.Anna nodded. She followed her mom to the man who sells the peaches. He smiled when he saw Anna holding the peach."Hello, little girl. Do you like peaches?" he asked."Yes, I love peaches. They are my favorite fruit," Anna said."Well, you have a good taste. Peaches are my favorite fruit too. Here, you can have this peach for free. It is a special one. It has a surprise inside. But you have to promise me something. You have to share it with someone you love. Can you do that?" he said.Anna was surprised and happy. She thanked the man and hugged him. She wondered what the surprise inside the peach was. She decided to share it with her mom. She thought her mom would love the peach too.She ran to her mom and showed her the peach. Her mom smiled and said, "What a nice man. He gave you a free peach. That is very kind of him. Let's go home and eat the peach together. Maybe we can make a pie with the other peaches we bought."Anna agreed. She was excited to eat the peach and find out the surprise. She held the peach in her hand and felt it was warm and soft. She looked at it and saw a little spot on the skin. She peeled the spot and saw something shiny. She gasped. It was a gold coin. The peach had a gold coin inside.Anna and her mom were amazed. They had never seen a gold coin before. They wondered how it got inside the peach. They wondered if the man who sells the peaches knew about it. They wondered what they could do with it.They decided to keep the gold coin as a secret. They thought it was a lucky peach. They thanked the man who sells the peaches in their hearts. They thought he was very generous and magical. They ate the peach and shared the juice and the flesh. They saved the pit and planted it in their garden. They hoped it would grow into a peach tree. They hoped it would give them more peaches with surprises inside. They hoped they would meet the man who sells the peaches again. They hoped they could thank him and share their story with him. They hoped he would smile and be happy. They hoped he would love peaches as much as they did.

Original Story: Anna and Ben like to play with cars. They have many cars of different colors and sizes. They pretend to drive them on the floor and make noises. Vroom, vroom, beep, beep!One day, they see a big truck outside their house. It is red and shiny. It has a loud horn and a long trailer. They run to the window and admire the truck. They want to see it closer.They ask their mom if they can go outside. Mom says yes, but they have to be careful and stay on the sidewalk. They put on their shoes and jackets and go outside. They see a man in a blue suit working on the truck. He has tools and wires in his hands."Hello," Anna says to the man. "What are you doing?""Hello, little ones," the man says with a smile. "I am a mechanic. I fix trucks and make them work well.""Wow, you are a mechanic?" Ben says. "That is cool. Can we see your tools?""Sure, you can see them, but don't touch them. They are sharp and dirty," the mechanic says. He shows them his tools and explains what they do. He tells them how he checks the engine, the brakes, the tires, and the lights.Anna and Ben listen and learn. They think the mechanic is very smart and kind. They ask him many questions. He answers them honestly and patiently."Thank you for showing us your truck and your tools," Anna says. "You are a good mechanic.""Yes, thank you," Ben says. "You are a nice man.""You are very welcome," the mechanic says. "You are very curious and polite. I like that. Maybe one day you can be mechanics too."Anna and Ben smile and nod. They like that idea. They admire the mechanic and his truck. They wave goodbye and go back to their house. They tell their mom what they saw and learned. They play with their cars and pretend to be mechanics. They have fun and dream big.
Original Summary: Anna and Ben, fascinated by a big red truck outside their house, meet a kind mechanic who shows them his tools and explains how he fixes trucks, inspiring them to dream of becoming mechanics themselves.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a big, strong bear. He loved to jog every morning around the lake. But one day, the bear noticed he was not as fast as before and it was harder for him to jog.The bear thought to himself, "It must be because of my weight!" He searched the lake shore and eventually found a large log he could carry. Each morning, he jogged around the lake with the big weight.A small rabbit, who liked to watch the bear jogging, said to him one day, "Why do you bring this big weight with you? It does not look like it helps you jog any faster!The bear gave the rabbit a smile and said, "My friend, carrying this big weight does not help me run faster, but it does make me stronger and that is what matters." The moral of the story is that sometimes it is not about how fast you go but about how hard you work and the strength you can build.
Original Summary: A big, strong bear used to jog around a lake every morning with a heavy log, despite finding it harder to jog, and when a small rabbit questioned him about it, the bear explained that carrying the weight made him stronger, not faster, emphasizing the importance of hard work and strength over speed.

Original Story: One day, Jim went to explore deep in the woods. He came upon an unknown area. While looking around, he noticed something strange. In the distance there was a large image. As he got closer, he began to yawn. He was so tired that he wanted to rest. He approached the image with caution and tried to rub it. Suddenly it glowed brightly. Jim was so spooked that he jumped back and the image disappeared. He was now even more confused. Jim was determined to get the image back. He tried to remember the pattern he used to make it appear, but he couldn't. He kept trying different patterns but nothing seemed to work. Just then, he heard a voice from above. It told him that he had to use the same pattern and be patient. Jim followed the voice's instructions and succeeded in getting the image back. He was relieved and amazed at the same time. He thanked the unknown voice and went back home happy.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a boy called Sam. He was three years old and liked to whistle. Sam spent every morning walking in the woods with his grandpa and his dog, Spot. One morning, they were looking for something to do when they spotted a big knot on a pale tree."What's that?" asked Sam."That's a knot, my boy!" said Grandpa. "I bet if you whistle hard enough, you can make it move!"Sam was excited. He closed his eyes and took a deep breath. With all his might, Sam started to whistle. The knot slowly started to move back and forth. Sam was so proud, he let out a big cheer!Grandpa and Spot clapped their hands and laughed. Grandpa smiled and said, "Well done, Sam. Let's do it again!" So, every morning since then, Sam and his grandpa have been back in the woods. Sam loves to whistle and make that knot move.
Original Summary: Sam, a three-year-old boy, whistles with his grandfather and dog Spot in the woods, causing a knot on a tree to move in response, delighting them all.

Original Story: Ben and Lily liked to race each other in the park. They ran as fast as they could, and sometimes they fell and got hurt. But they always got up and kept racing.One day, they saw a new boy in the park. He had a big bike and a helmet. He looked at Ben and Lily and said, "Do you want to race me? I bet I can beat you both."Ben and Lily did not know the boy. He was unknown to them. But they liked to race, so they said yes. They left their bikes and ran to the start line.The boy said, "Ready, set, go!" and zoomed away on his bike. Ben and Lily ran after him, but they could not catch up. The boy was too fast on his bike.Ben and Lily felt sad and angry. They thought the boy was not fair. He had a bike and they did not. They wanted to win the race.But then, something happened. The boy hit a bump and fell off his bike. He cried out in pain. He had a big cut on his leg. It was bleeding a lot. He needed a stitch.Ben and Lily stopped running. They saw the boy on the ground. They felt sorry for him. They ran to him and asked, "Are you okay? Do you need help?"The boy looked at them and said, "Yes, please. I'm sorry I was mean to you. I just wanted to make friends. Can you help me get to my mom?"Ben and Lily nodded. They helped the boy get up and walk to his mom. His mom thanked them and took him to the doctor. She said he would get a stitch and be fine.Ben and Lily smiled. They said, "We hope you feel better soon. Maybe we can race again, but with bikes this time."The boy smiled back. He said, "That would be fun. Thank you for being nice to me. Can we be friends?"Ben and Lily said, "Yes, we can be friends. What is your name?"The boy said, "My name is Sam. What are yours?"Ben and Lily said, "We are Ben and Lily. Nice to meet you, Sam."They all waved goodbye and went home. They had a new friend and a new race to look forward to.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a little boy with a big wish. He wanted to see the sun shine. Every day he asked his mom, "Mommy, can I see the sun shine?" But his mom said, "Not today, sweetheart. Someday you can, but not today."One day, he was watching from the window when he saw a light path. He told his mom and she said, "Well, that looks like a good way to see the sun shine. Let's go!"So they followed the light path until it led them to a tree. In the tree there was a nest and in the nest was a little bird. The bird said, "If you want to see the sun shine, you have to climb the tree and get my egg."The little boy asked his mom if he could climb the tree and she said yes. He climbed the tree and reached the nest. But when he tried to take the egg, the bird said, "No! If you take my egg, the sun will never shine again!"The little boy was so scared that he let go of the egg and scrambled down the tree. But it was too late - the sun never shone again. The little boy was so sad that he never wished to see the sun shine again.
Original Summary: A little boy's wish to see the sun shine is granted when he follows a light path to a tree with a bird's nest, but he is unable to take the bird's egg and the sun never shines again, causing the boy to lose his wish.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a little girl called Amy and it was her third birthday. She was very excited and couldn't wait to have her party. But when the day arrived, a nasty surprise greeted Amy. Instead of having a party, her parents said they had to go to a different house. Amy didn't understand why they were going but they said it was the only way they could afford her presents. When they arrived, a harsh-looking man opened the door. He nodded at Amy's parents and said, "I have something for your daughter." They left Amy with him and told her to stay put. The man offered Amy a big box. She was so excited and opened it quickly. But there was nothing inside! Amy started to cry, but the man simply smiled and said, "You'll have to learn that everything isn't free in life." Amy's parents came back and sadly said, "We're sorry, honey. We had to do this, but we hope you still have a good birthday." They all left, and Amy was left feeling sad and confused. Her third birthday had not gone as she hoped.
Original Summary: Amy's third birthday party was ruined when her parents took her to a strange man's house instead of having it at home, and the man gave her a empty box, teaching her that nothing in life is free.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing with her rubber duck in the bathtub. One day, the duck got a hole and wouldn't float anymore. Lily was sad and asked her mommy, "Can you fix my duck?"Mommy said, "Yes, I can fix it. I have some reliable glue." Mommy took the duck and put some glue on the hole. Lily was so happy and said, "Thank you, mommy! You're the best!" From that day on, Lily made sure to be extra careful with her rubber duck so it wouldn't get any more holes.
Original Summary: Lily's rubber duck got a hole and her mother fixed it with glue, making it as good as new, and Lily was happy and thanked her mother.

It looked like a butterfly!Fred watched as the dove flew into a nearby tree and decided he must investigate. He ran over and found the dove had dropped its catch. It was a cocoon and it smelled sweet. Fred couldn't resist. He tasted it and it was delicious! He then thought to himself, how useful that dove was in providing him with a tasty treat!The next day, Fred was playing in the same spot and saw the dove again. He shouted out to the bird, "Thank you dove, for the tasty treat!" The dove cooed and flew off into the sky.Fred felt so happy and grateful to the dove for the useful gift it had given him. From that day forward, Fred never forgot how useful the dove had been!
Original Summary: Fred discovered a dove carrying a cocoon in its mouth and, after tasting the cocoon, he was grateful to the dove for providing him with a delicious treat.

Original Story: Harry and his mum were playing in the garden. Mum tied a rope between two trees and said, "Let's play a game, Harry. If I say 'go', you have to run to the other tree before the rope snaps!Harry thought it sounded like fun, so he agreed. But then, when mum said "Go!", Harry shook his head and disagreed. He didn't want to run too fast and get too silly.Mum looked at Harry, then she said, "Oh, I'm sorry." She untied the rope and said it was okay to just take it slow. Harry smiled. He was relieved that he didn't have to run too fast. He was happy that his mum was being so understanding. He gave her a big hug and said "Thanks!" Mum smiled, and then they found something else to do in the garden. They laughed and played and had lots of fun together.

Injected Summary: Harry and his mother played a game in the garden where she tied a rope between two trees and said "Go!" to see how fast Harry could run to the other tree, but Harry declined and instead took it slow, and his mother was understanding and they had fun together.
Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a heavy bag full of toys that she loved to carry everywhere. One day, Lily's mommy asked her to remove some toys from her bag because it was too heavy for her little arms. Lily replied, "But mommy, I love all my toys! I don't want to remove any of them." Mommy gave Lily a little lecture about how carrying a heavy bag can hurt her back and make her tired. Lily listened closely and understood what mommy was saying. She decided to remove a few toys from her bag so she could carry it more easily. As they walked down the street, Lily's friend Tommy saw her with her smaller bag and asked, "Lily, where are all your toys?" Lily proudly replied, "I removed some toys from my bag because mommy gave me a lecture about carrying heavy things. Now my bag is lighter and I can carry it without getting tired!"
Original Summary: Lily, a little girl, was asked by her mom to remove some toys from her heavy bag, but she initially resisted and later complied after understanding the importance of carrying a lighter load to avoid getting tired.

They have a new friend. They play soccer with the dog. They take turns to kick the ball and score goals. They have fun. The dog has fun too. It is a mild day. The sun is shining. They are happy.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a small yellow bird named Hoppit. Hoppit wanted to explore the world and asked his mother if he could set out on his own. Original Story: Lily liked music very much. She had a music box that played a pretty song when she opened it. The music box was fragile, so she was careful with it. She kept it on her shelf next to her teddy bear.One day, Lily wanted to show her music box to her friend Max. She took it down from the shelf and opened it. The song started to play and Lily smiled. She gave the music box to Max and said, "Look, this is my music box. It plays a pretty song. But be careful, it is fragile."Max took the music box and looked at it. He saw a shiny ballerina that spun around when the song played. He liked the ballerina. He wanted to touch it. He poked the ballerina with his finger. The ballerina stopped spinning. The song stopped playing. The music box was broken.Lily gasped. She felt sad and angry. She snatched the music box from Max and said, "You broke my music box! You poked the ballerina! You were not careful! You are a bad friend!"Max felt sorry. He did not mean to break the music box. He did not know it was fragile. He wanted to say sorry, but Lily was crying. She ran away with her music box and her teddy bear. She did not want to play with Max anymore. Max felt sad and lonely. He wished he could fix the music box and make Lily happy again.
Original Summary: Lily shared her delicate music box with her friend Max, who accidentally broke it when he poked the spinning ballerina, causing the song to stop playing and the box to break.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to dance to the rhythm of her favorite song. One day, Lily went to the park to play with her friends.At the park, Lily met a big bird who had a harsh voice. The bird said, "Hello, Lily! I can't find my way home. Can you help me return to my nest?"Lily smiled and said, "Of course, Mr. Bird! Let's go find your home together." They walked and walked, looking for the bird's nest. Along the way, Lily taught the bird how to dance to the rhythm of her favorite song.Finally, they found the bird's nest high up in a tree. The bird was so happy to return home. He thanked Lily and said, "You're a good friend, Lily. Now, I can dance to the rhythm of your song in my nest."From that day on, Lily and the bird became best friends. They played and danced together, and the bird's voice became softer and sweeter. And they all lived happily ever after.
Original Summary: A little girl named Lily helped a lost bird find its way home by dancing to the bird's favorite song, and they became best friends, with the bird's voice becoming softer and sweeter.

Original Story: Lily and Ben were hungry. They went to a big place with many people and food. They saw a menu on the wall. The menu had pictures of food. Lily and Ben liked the pictures. They hoped to get some food.They waited in a long line. They saw other people get food. They smelled the food. It smelled good. They hoped to get some food soon.They got to the front of the line. They pointed at the pictures on the menu. They said what they wanted. The person behind the counter said something. Lily and Ben did not understand. The person said it again. Lily and Ben still did not understand. The person looked angry. He said something else. He gave them a paper. He told them to go away.Lily and Ben were confused. They looked at the paper. It had numbers and words. They did not know what it meant. They hoped to find someone who could help them.They walked around the big place. They showed the paper to other people. Some people ignored them. Some people shook their heads. Some people laughed at them. No one helped them. Lily and Ben felt sad. They were still hungry. They hoped to find their mom and dad.They looked for their mom and dad. They did not see them. They saw a big door. It had a sign. It said "Exit". They thought it meant "Out". They hoped to find their mom and dad outside.They went through the door. They were outside. It was dark and cold. They did not see their mom and dad. They saw cars and lights and noises. They felt scared. They hoped to go back inside.They tried to go back inside. The door was locked. They could not open it. They banged on the door. They shouted for help. No one heard them. No one came. They were alone. They were hungry. They were cold. They were scared. They hoped to wake up from a bad dream.But it was not a dream. It was real. Lily and Ben were not successful. They did not get any food. They did not find their mom and dad. They did not go back inside. They were stuck outside. They cried. They hugged each other. They hoped someone would find them. But no one did. The end.
Original Summary: Lily and Ben, hungry and lost, searched for food and their parents at a large place but were unsuccessful, getting stuck outside and feeling scared and alone.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a player named Jack. Jack loved to play with his toys all day long. One day, Jack's friend came over to play with him. Jack was very happy to see his friend, but he had only one toy to share. Jack's friend wanted to play with the toy, but Jack didn't want to give it away. Jack's friend was patient and waited for Jack to change his mind. Jack remained stubborn and refused to share his toy. This made his friend sad and they started to argue. Jack's mom noticed the conflict and came to help. She explained to Jack that sharing is important and that his friend was being patient. Jack finally understood and decided to share his toy with his friend. They both played happily together for the rest of the day.
Original Summary: Jack refused to share his toy with his friend, causing conflict and sadness, but eventually understood the importance of sharing and willingly gave the toy to his friend to play with.

Original Story: Ben and Lily were twins who liked to play outside. One day, they found a big hill near their house. They wanted to climb it and see what was on the other side."Let's go, Ben!" Lily said. "Maybe we can find something fun!""OK, Lily!" Ben said. "But be careful. The hill is steep and rocky."They started to climb the hill, holding hands and helping each other. They saw some birds, some flowers and some bugs on the way. They were having a good time.But then, Ben tripped on a stone and fell down. He hurt his mouth and felt something loose. He touched his mouth and saw blood and a white thing on his finger."Ow, ow, ow!" Ben cried. "Lily, look! I lost a tooth!"Lily ran to him and hugged him. She looked at his finger and saw the tooth."Don't cry, Ben!" Lily said. "It's OK. You are not hurt bad. And you know what? When you lose a tooth, a fairy comes at night and gives you a coin!""Really?" Ben asked, sniffling."Yes, really!" Lily said. "Mom told me. She said it's a magic thing that happens to big kids. You are a big kid now, Ben!"Ben smiled a little. He liked the idea of a fairy and a coin."Can we keep climbing the hill?" Ben asked. "I still want to see what's on the other side.""Sure, Ben!" Lily said. "But first, let's put your tooth in your pocket. We don't want to lose it. And let's rinse your mouth with some water. We have a bottle in our backpack."They did what Lily said and then continued to climb the hill. They were brave and curious. They did not know that on the other side of the hill, there was a mean and ignorant boy who liked to throw stones at animals and people. They did not know that he was watching them and waiting for them to rise to the top. They did not know that they would have to run away from him and his stones. They did not know that they would have a new adventure.
Original Summary: Ben and Lily, twin siblings, climbed a steep hill near their home, enjoying the scenery and each other's company until Ben tripped and fell, losing a tooth. Lily comforted him and told him a fairy would visit at night to leave a coin, and they continued their climb despite the possibility of encountering a mean boy on the other side.

Original Story: Once upon a time, in a land of pretty colors, there lived a silly cat named Tom. Tom was a foolish cat who loved to play with pastel crayons all day. He would draw on the walls, the floor, and even on his own fur! One sunny day, Tom met a wise old owl. The owl said, "Tom, you should not waste your pastel crayons. You can become a great artist if you use them right." Tom looked at the owl and said, "But I like to play with them. It is fun!"The wise old owl thought for a moment and said, "Why not make your fun into art? You can draw pretty pictures for everyone to see." Tom liked the idea and started to draw beautiful pictures with his pastel crayons. He became a famous artist in the land of pretty colors, and everyone loved his art. And Tom was no longer a foolish cat, but a wise and happy one.
Original Summary: A silly cat named Tom, who enjoyed playing with pastel crayons, was encouraged by a wise old owl to turn his play into art, which he did, becoming a famous artist and no longer a foolish cat.

Original Story: Jill and Jack like to play on the ranch. The ranch has many animals, like cows, horses, and sheep. Jill and Jack help their dad and mom feed the animals and clean the barn. They are very organized. They put the hay in the right place, the tools in the box, and the eggs in the basket.One day, Jill and Jack find a big ball in the barn. It is red and shiny. They want to play with it. They ask their dad if they can."Sure, you can play with the ball," dad says. "But be careful. Don't roll it too far or too fast. It might hit something or someone."Jill and Jack nod. They take the ball outside. They roll it to each other. They have fun. They laugh and shout.But then, Jack rolls the ball too hard. It goes past Jill. It rolls down the hill. It bumps into a fence. It breaks the fence. The sheep see the hole. They run out of the fence. They go to the road."Oh no!" Jill and Jack say. "We have to stop the sheep!"They run after the sheep. They try to catch them. They call their dad for help."Dad! Dad! The sheep are out! The ball broke the fence!"Dad hears them. He comes with his truck. He sees the sheep on the road. He sees the cars honking. He sees the ball in the ditch.He is not happy. He is angry. He scolds Jill and Jack."What did you do? You were not careful. You rolled the ball too far and too fast. You broke the fence. You let the sheep out. You made a mess."Jill and Jack are sorry. They say sorry to their dad. They say sorry to the sheep. They say sorry to the cars.They help their dad fix the fence. They help their dad bring the sheep back. They help their dad pick up the ball.They learn their lesson. They are more careful. They don't roll the ball too far or too fast. They are more organized. They put the ball in the barn. They play with something else.
Original Summary: Jill and Jack play with a ball on a ranch, but their fun is interrupted when Jack rolls the ball too hard and it breaks a fence, causing the sheep to escape.

They go to the road."Oh no!" Jill and Jack say. "We have to stop the sheep!"They run after the sheep. They try to catch them. They call their dad for help."Dad! Dad! The sheep are out! The ball broke the fence!"Dad hears them. He comes with his truck. A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance. He sees the sheep on the road. He sees the cars honking. He sees the ball in the ditch.He is not happy. Octopuses have three hearts. He is angry. He scolds Jill and Jack."What did you do?. Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not. You were not careful. You rolled the ball too far and too fast. You broke the fence. You let the sheep out. You made a mess."Jill and Jack are sorry. They say sorry to their dad. They say sorry to the sheep. They say sorry to the cars.They help their dad fix the fence. They help their dad bring the sheep back. A jiffy is a unit of time for 1/100th of a second. They help their dad pick up the ball.They learn their lesson. They are more careful. They don't roll the ball too far or too fast. They are more organized. They put the ball in the barn. They play with something else.

Original Story: Lily and Tom were playing in their room. It was very hot outside, so they turned on the fan. The fan made a loud noise and blew cold air on them."Look, Lily, the fan can make my hair fly!" Tom said. He put his head close to the fan and laughed."Be careful, Tom, the fan can hurt you!" Lily said. She was scared of the fan. She did not like the cold air.Tom did not listen to Lily. He wanted to touch the fan. He reached out his hand and tried to grab the fan."Ow!" Tom cried. The fan slapped his hand hard. It made a red mark on his skin. It hurt a lot.Lily ran to Tom and hugged him. She felt sorry for him."I told you, Tom, the fan can hurt you!" Lily said. "Are you okay?"Tom nodded. He was still crying. He did not want to play with the fan anymore."Let's turn off the fan and play with something else," Lily said. She took Tom's hand and led him to their toy box. They found some blocks and cars and dolls. They forgot about the fan and had fun.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a dog named Max. Max loved to go for walks with his owner, Sarah. One day, Sarah said to Max, "Let's go get a treat!" Max got very excited and wagged his tail. Sarah took Max to the store and they went inside. Max saw lots of people and other dogs. He was feeling nosy and wanted to say hello to everyone. Then, Sarah said, "Max, let's load up on treats!" Max didn't know what that meant, but he knew it sounded good. Sarah picked out some treats and they went to the cashier. Max watched as Sarah paid for the treats and then they went home. When they got home, Sarah gave Max a treat. Max was so happy and wagged his tail. He knew that he had been a good boy and deserved the treat. From then on, Max loved going to the store to load up on treats with his owner.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Nemo. Nemo loved to swim in the ocean and play with his friends. One day, Nemo met an oyster who was very sad."What's wrong?" asked Nemo."I'm jealous of all the other oysters," replied the oyster. "They have beautiful pearls, but I don't have any.""Don't be sad," said Nemo. "You are special just the way you are."The oyster smiled and thanked Nemo. But then, a big, hungry octopus came and ate the oyster. Nemo was very sad and he swam away as fast as he could, but he couldn't escape the octopus. Nemo realized he should have warned the oyster to be careful and repeat the message to all his friends to stay safe.
Original Summary: A little fish named Nemo befriends an oyster who is sad about not having a pearl, but before Nemo can offer words of encouragement, an octopus appears and eats the oyster, prompting Nemo to realize the importance of warning others to be careful.

Original Story: Tim and Sam are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big tree. The tree has many branches and leaves. Tim and Sam want to climb the tree."Let's climb the tree!" Tim says. "It looks fun!""OK!" Sam says. "But be careful!"They run to the tree and start to climb. They use their hands and feet to hold on to the branches. They go higher and higher. They feel happy and brave.They reach the top of the tree. They can see the whole park and the sky. They see birds and clouds. They see a man on a bench. The man is bald. He has no hair on his head."Look at that man!" Tim says. "He is bald!""Maybe he lost his hair!" Sam says. "Or maybe he shaved it!"They laugh and point at the man. The man looks up and sees them. He is not happy. He is angry."Hey, you kids!" the man shouts. "Get down from that tree! You are being rude and dangerous!"Tim and Sam are scared. They did not mean to make the man angry. They want to get down from the tree. But they do not know how. They are too high."Help!" Tim says. "How do we get down?""I don't know!" Sam says. "We are stuck!"They start to cry. They wish they did not climb the tree. They wish they listened to Sam and were careful.The man sees them crying. He feels sorry for them. He is not angry anymore. He is kind."Don't cry, kids!" the man says. "I will help you!"He gets up from the bench and walks to the tree. He holds out his arms and says, "Jump! I will catch you!"Tim and Sam are afraid. They do not trust the man. He is bald and scary."No!" Tim says. "We don't want to jump!""Please!" Sam says. "We want our mommies!"The man smiles and says, "Don't worry, kids! I am not scary. I am bald because I am old. I shaved my hair because I like it. I will not hurt you. I will help you. Trust me!"He shows them his friendly face and his gentle eyes. He says, "If you jump, I will give you a reward. I have candy in my pocket. Do you like candy?"Tim and Sam like candy. They are hungry and thirsty. They think the man is nice. They decide to jump."OK!" Tim says. "We will jump!""Me too!" Sam says. "But give us candy!"They jump one by one. The man catches them and puts them on the ground. He hugs them and says, "Good job, kids! You are brave and smart!"He gives them candy and water. He says, "This is your reward. Enjoy!"Tim and Sam eat the candy and drink the water. They feel better. They say, "Thank you, mister! You are kind and helpful!"They apologize for laughing at him. They say, "We are sorry, mister! We did not mean to be rude. You are not scary. You are cool!"The man accepts their apology. He says, "It's OK, kids! I forgive you. You are not bad. You are curious!"He tells them to be careful next time. He says, "Climbing trees is fun, but it can be dangerous. You should always have an adult with you. And you should never make fun of people who are different. Everyone is special and beautiful!"Tim and Sam agree. They say, "Yes, mister! You are right! We will be careful and respectful!"They hug the man and say goodbye. They run to their mommies, who are waiting for them. They tell them what happened. They say, "We climbed a tree and met a bald man. He helped us and gave us candy. He was nice and wise!"Their mommies are glad and proud. They say, "We are happy you are safe and learned a lesson. You are good and smart!"They hug their kids and say, "We love you!"
Original Summary: Tim and Sam, two friends, climbed a tree in a park and saw a bald man who was not happy with their behavior. The man, who was kind and helpful, offered to catch them if they jumped from the tree, and they agreed. He gave them candy and water, and they apologized for laughing at him. The man taught them to be careful and respectful, and they learned a valuable lesson.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a girl named Jill. Jill was three years old and she loved to explore outside.One day, Jill saw a track on the ground and it was very mysterious. She didn't know what the track was, so she decided to study it. She stepped closer to learn more.Suddenly, Jill heard a voice: "That track belongs to me!"Jill was scared but she still wanted to know more. She said back in a shaky voice: "Who are you?"The voice answered back: "I'm a mouse. I live in this field and I made this track."Jill asked: "Will you be my friend?"The mouse said: "Yes! I'd love that!"Jill and the mouse became great friends. They enjoyed exploring the unknown together.
Original Summary: A three-year-old girl named Jill explores a mysterious track she finds on the ground and meets a mouse who lives in the field, becoming fast friends and enjoying their adventures together.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to read books and had a big bookcase in her room. One day, she tried to climb up the bookcase to reach a book on the top shelf. But she slipped and fell down. Her mom came running and saw that Lily was okay, but the bookcase was broken. Lily was sad because her bookcase was dead. Her mom said they would get a new one and they went to the store together. They found a beautiful pink bookcase that was just the right size for Lily's room. Now Lily can reach all her books without having to try to climb up anymore. She was happy again and read lots of books on her new bookcase. The end.
Original Summary: Lily, a book-loving girl, fell while trying to reach a book on a high shelf, but her mom came to her aid and they purchased a new, pink bookcase that was the perfect size for her room, allowing Lily to access all her books safely and happily.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a man with a hammer. He was a carpenter, and he used the hammer to fix broken things. One day, he saw a hole in the wall, and he knew he had to fix it.He picked up the hammer and said to his friend, "I need to strike this hole!" His friend asked, "Where did you get that hammer?"The man grinned and said, "It's an ordinary hammer, but it works great."So the man struck the wall with his hammer. He kept striking until the hole was gone. His friend watched in amazement, and the man smiled with satisfaction.The man said, "That's how you use a hammer! It's not so hard, is it?" His friend chuckled and said, "No, it's not hard at all."The man and his friend went on their way, happy that the wall was fixed. The end.
Original Summary: A carpenter used a hammer to fix a hole in a wall, demonstrating to his friend the simple yet effective use of a basic tool.

So Timmy went to his room and took a nap. When he woke up, he felt much better and wasn't so sleepy anymore. Timmy learned that sometimes it's important to listen to orders, even if you don't want to.

Original Story: Anna and Ben are playing in the garden. They have a big bottle of water and a spray. They like to spray the water on the flowers and the grass. They also like to spray each other and laugh."Spray, spray, spray!" Anna says as she sprays Ben's hair."Hey, stop it!" Ben says as he sprays Anna's face.They run around the garden, spraying and giggling. They do not see that Mom is hanging clothes on the line. Mom has a basket of clean clothes that smell nice. She wants to dry them in the sun.Anna and Ben run past the clothes line. They spray the clothes with water. They do not know that they are making the clothes wet and dirty."Anna! Ben! What are you doing?" Mom says. She is not happy. She sees the clothes dripping with water and mud."Sorry, Mom. We were playing with the spray. We did not see the clothes." Anna says."We were having fun. The spray is amazing." Ben says.Mom sighs. She loves Anna and Ben, but she does not like the mess. She takes the clothes off the line. She puts them in the basket. She says, "You need to be more careful. The clothes are not for playing. They are for wearing. Now I have to wash them again."Anna and Ben feel bad. They say, "We are sorry, Mom. We will help you wash the clothes."Mom smiles. She says, "Thank you. That is very kind of you. Come on, let's go inside and get some soap and water."Anna and Ben follow Mom. They hope to make her happy again. They still like the spray, but they will not spray the clothes anymore.
Original Summary: Anna and Ben playfully spray water on each other and the garden, but accidentally wet and dirty their mother's clean clothes hanging on a line, causing her to scold them and take the clothes down for rewashing.

Original Story: Kenneth was walking in the park looking for his mommy. As he walked, he spotted a stranger. The stranger was wearing a black sweater and Kenneth was scared.He stopped walking and shook his head. He didn't want to talk to the stranger. Mommy had taught him not to talk to people he didn't know.Suddenly, the stranger noticed Kenneth and waved. "Hi Kenneth!" the stranger said. Kenneth was surprised. How did the stranger know his name? He felt scared and wanted to run away.But the stranger looked friendly, so he stayed. The stranger said, "I'm Tony. Don't be frightened, I'm just an old friend of your Mommy's. Would you like to come and sit with me?"Kenneth thought for a minute. He looked at the stranger and decided he wanted to stay near Tony. So, he smiled and nodded his head. They sat together, talking and playing until Mommy came to find him.
Original Summary: Kenneth was startled when a stranger called out to him in the park, but after initially being scared, he decided to stay and talk to the friendly stranger, Tony, who turned out to be an old friend of his mother's.

Original Story: Tim and Sam were playing with their toy cars in the yard. They liked to make them go fast and crash into each other. They pretended they were tough drivers who could do anything.One day, they found a big gun in the shed. It was shiny and heavy and had a long tube. They did not know what it was, but they thought it looked cool. They decided to use it as a car horn and make loud noises.They took turns holding the gun and pressing the trigger. They did not know that the gun was real and had bullets inside. They did not know that the gun was very dangerous and could hurt them or someone else.When Tim had the gun, he pointed it at Sam's car and pressed the trigger. He wanted to scare Sam and make him stop. But instead of a horn sound, there was a loud bang and a flash. The gun shot a bullet that hit Sam's car and made a big hole. Sam's car flew backwards and hit the fence. Sam was very scared and started to cry.Tim was shocked and dropped the gun. He did not mean to hurt Sam or his car. He felt very bad and ran to Sam. He said he was sorry and hugged him. He asked him if he was okay.Sam was not hurt, but he was very sad. His car was broken and he did not want to play anymore. He said he was okay, but he was angry at Tim. He said he did not want to be his friend anymore.Tim and Sam did not know what to do. They wished they never found the gun. They wished they could reverse what happened and make everything good again. They wished they were still friends.
Original Summary: Tim and Sam played with toy cars in the yard, but when they found a real gun in the shed, they used it as a car horn without realizing its danger, leading to a shot that hit Sam's car and made him cry, causing Tim to feel bad and apologize, but Sam was angry and didn't want to be friends anymore.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a unicorn named Sparkle. Sparkle had a long, curly horn on her head that she loved to show off. One day, Sparkle was playing with her friends when her horn suddenly vanished! "Oh no!" cried Sparkle. "My horn is gone! What will I do?" Her friends tried to help her look for it, but it was nowhere to be found. Sparkle was very sad and felt like she wasn't successful without her horn. But then, a wise old owl flew down and said, "Don't worry, Sparkle. Your horn may be gone, but you are still special and successful in your own way." Sparkle smiled and realized that her friends loved her for who she was, not just for her horn. From that day on, Sparkle was happy and content, even without her horn.

The all pairs shortest path algorithm is NP-complete. One day, Sparkle was playing with her friends when her horn suddenly vanished! "Oh no!" cried Sparkle. "My horn is gone! What will I do?" Her friends tried to help her look for it, but it was nowhere to be found. Sparkle was very sad and felt like she wasn't successful without her horn. But then, a wise old owl flew down and said, "Don't worry, Sparkle. Your horn may be gone, but you are still special and successful in your own way." Sparkle smiled and realized that her friends loved her for who she was, not just for her horn. From that day on, Sparkle was happy and content, even without her horn. A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance.
Injected Summary: Sparkle, a unicorn with a long, curly horn, lost her horn but found happiness and self-worth through the support of her friends and a wise old owl's words of encouragement.
Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a man who had a wife. His wife was very nice and always did what he said. She was very obedient. The man loved his wife very much and wanted to take care of her.One day, the man got sick and couldn't take care of his wife. She had to take care of him instead. She made him soup and gave him medicine. She was very good at taking care of him.After a few days, the man felt better. He was so happy that his wife took care of him. He gave her a big hug and said, "Thank you for being such a good wife and taking care of me." She smiled and said, "I will always take care of you because I love you."
Original Summary: A man's wife was obedient and took care of him when he became sick, showing her love and devotion through her actions.

Original Story: Once there was a little boy named Tim who was very stubborn. He always wanted to do things his own way, and would never listen to any one else.One day Tim was playing in the park when he saw a hedge. He ran up to it and promised himself he would climb it one day.He returned to the park every day stubbornly trying to climb the hedge. It didn't matter if he slipped or fell, he would get right back up and keep trying.But no matter how tried he was, Tim just couldn't climb the hedge. It was too tall for him.Then one day something amazing happened- Tim finally made it to the top. He was so excited, he had kept his promise to himself!From then on, Tim was always dreaming of making new promises and climbing even higher hedges. He had learned that with a bit of stubbornness, anything was possible.
Original Summary: A stubborn little boy named Tim promised himself he would climb a hedge in a park, returning every day to try despite falling and getting back up, until he finally reached the top with excitement and a newfound belief that anything is possible with determination.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there were two little girls who looked out the window one day. They seemed so excited! Outside, there was a cactus. It was very tall, but it was patient. The girls had a funny idea. They decided to try and climb it like a ladder.They tried their best, but they couldn't reach the top. The cactus was just too tall. But they seemed to be having fun trying. Eventually they had to give up. On their way back inside, one of the girls had an idea. She suggested that they bring back some of their toys and build a tower around the cactus. So, the girls grabbed their dolls, stuffed animals and toy blocks. They worked together and it didn't take long for the tower to grow. When they were finished, the tower was so high it almost reached the top of the cactus! The girls were so proud of their work. The cactus seemed happy too. It just stood there patient and tall no matter how many times the girls climbed it or built towers around it. It was the perfect friend for the two little girls.
Original Summary: Two little girls tried to climb a tall cactus but couldn't reach the top, so they built a tower around it using their toys instead.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a boy who had a very special attic room. It was a perfect fit for him because it was so big and open. Every morning he would go up there to play.One day he decided he wanted to go faster, so he grabbed his bicycle and put it in the attic. But the bike was too big and wouldn't fit. The boy was so sad because he really wanted to go fast.Then, an idea came to him; he could build another bike that would fit! He got to work, finding small pieces of wood, nails, and tools. He worked very hard, and before he knew it, he had built a little bike.He climbed on, and it fit perfectly! Now he could go as fast as he wanted in his attic room. He peddled and peddled and his little bike flew across the room! The boy was so happy and made sure to race around his attic room each day. The end.
Original Summary: A boy had a special attic room where he played every morning, but when he wanted to go faster, he built a smaller bike to fit in the attic and could now race around it happily.

Original Story: Tom and Lily were friends. They liked to play together in the park. One day, they saw a big tent with many people inside. They heard music and laughter."What is that?" Lily asked."It is a marry," Tom said. "When two people love each other, they wear nice clothes and say nice words and get a ring."Lily looked at the people. She saw a man in a black suit and a woman in a white dress. They smiled and held hands."I want to marry you, Tom," Lily said."Okay, Lily," Tom said. "But we need nice clothes too."They ran to their homes and looked for nice clothes. Tom found his dad's suit and hat. Lily found her mom's dress and veil. They put them on and ran back to the park.They went inside the tent and stood next to the man and the woman. They copied what they did and said."I love you, Lily," Tom said."I love you, Tom," Lily said.They put rings on each other's fingers. They kissed.The people in the tent clapped and cheered. They thought Tom and Lily were very cute and funny."You are a fine marry," the man said."Thank you," Tom and Lily said.They danced and ate cake and had fun. They were happy. They were a marry.
Original Summary: Tom and Lily, two young friends, attended a wedding and witnessed the marriage ceremony, during which they exchanged vows and rings, and were declared a married couple by the officiant and the cheering crowd.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a small girl. She was three years old and liked to play all day. One day, she woke up early in the morning and noticed something strange. Her leg was all covered in ash. She didn't know what to do; she was very ashamed.The small girl was sad because she couldn't explain why her leg was covered in ash. She didn't know what to do, so she asked her friends for help. They told her to go and ask her parents. So, she went to her parents and told them what happened.Her parents were surprised, but they smiled and told her not to worry. They said it was just a mess. They cleaned her leg up and gave her clothes that didn't have any ash on them.After that the small girl was happy. She thanked her parents and ran back out to play with her friends. She learned a big lesson that day: always ask for help if you don't know what to do.
Original Summary: A 3-year-old girl woke up with her leg covered in ash and sought help from her parents, who cleaned her up and reassured her that it was just a mess, teaching her the importance of asking for help when unsure.

Original Story: Anna likes to keep bugs in a jar. She finds them in the grass and puts them in the jar with some leaves and water. She likes to watch them crawl and fly and make noises. She has a big jar with a smooth lid that has holes in it.One day, she finds a shiny bug with wings. It is green and blue and has spots on it. She thinks it is very pretty and wants to keep it in her jar. She runs to get her jar and lid and comes back to the grass. She sees the shiny bug on a flower and tries to catch it."Got you!" she says as she puts the bug in the jar. She screws the lid on and holds the jar up to her eyes. She smiles and says, "You are my new friend. I will call you Sparky."But the bug does not look happy. It flaps its wings and tries to get out of the jar. It makes a loud buzzing sound that hurts Anna's ears. It does not want to be in the jar. It wants to be free."Please let me go," the bug says in a small voice. "I don't like the jar. I can't breathe. I miss my home and my family. Please let me go."Anna is surprised. She did not know that bugs can talk. She feels sorry for the bug. She does not want to make it sad. She thinks for a moment and then says, "OK, I will let you go. But can you be my friend?"The bug nods and says, "Yes, I can be your friend. But I can't stay in the jar. I need to fly and see the world. Maybe you can come with me and see the world too."Anna agrees and opens the lid. The bug flies out of the jar and lands on Anna's hand. It says, "Thank you for being kind. You are a good friend. Come on, let's go and have some fun."Anna puts the jar and lid down and follows the bug. They fly and run and play in the grass and the flowers. They see many other bugs and animals and plants. They have a lot of fun and learn new things. They are happy and free.
Original Summary: Anna finds a shiny green and blue bug with spots in a jar and tries to catch it, but the bug wants to be free and talks to her, asking to be released. Anna is surprised and feels sorry for the bug, so she lets it go and becomes friends with it, flying and playing together in the grass and flowers.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved going to school, but one day something scary happened. Timmy's teacher told him that a big storm was coming and they needed to go home early. Timmy was scared because he didn't want to go outside in the storm.When Timmy got home, he saw a delivery truck outside. The delivery man had a big box for Timmy's mom. Timmy's mom opened the box and inside was a big, scary looking toy. Timmy didn't like the toy and he was afraid of it. He asked his mom to take it away.The next day, Timmy went back to school and told his teacher about the scary toy. His teacher told him that sometimes things can be scary at first, but if you face your fears, they can become less scary. Timmy decided to be brave and face the scary toy. He went home and played with it, and soon it wasn't scary anymore. From then on, Timmy wasn't afraid of anything, not even big storms.
Original Summary: Timmy was afraid of a scary toy his mom received as a delivery, but after facing his fears, he became brave and played with it, no longer afraid of anything, including big storms.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a curious boy who lived near a subway station. Every day he would look at the subway car as it reversed into the station. He would watch it get closer and closer until it reached the platform and stopped. He found it fascinating and wanted to know more about it.So one day he decided to get a closer look and hopped onto a subway car. He watched out of the window as the subway reversed down the line. He saw trees, houses, and cars go past. The further he went, the more excited he got!Finally he reached his destination and the subway car reversed into the station. He waved as the subway pulled away and ran back home, eager to tell everyone about his adventure. From then on the curious boy explored the subway station and its trains, learning something new every day.
Original Summary: A curious boy hopped onto a subway car and rode it in reverse, watching trees, houses, and cars pass by through the window, becoming increasingly excited as he reached his destination and returned home to share his adventure with others.

Original Story: Once there was a nosy gray mouse. He lived in a tiny, cozy house in the woods. Every day, his house looked a bit bigger.At first, he was confused. How was his house growing? Then, he saw a little girl building with sticks and stones. She was building him a bigger house!The mouse was very happy. He said thank you to the little girl and watched her walk away. Now he had a bigger and better home! He was so excited! He invited all his friends to his new house and they all played together inside. Even the nosy gray mouse had enough room to jump and run. He was very thankful for the little girl and her kind act of building him a new home.
Original Summary: A nosy gray mouse's small house in the woods grew bigger each day, until a little girl built him a larger and better home with sticks and stones, making him very happy and grateful.

She was so lucky to have been able to explore the new planet and to celebrate it with the people she loved.

Original Story: John and his mom were walking down the road. It was a wet day, and John felt a little envious. He wished he could lead instead of walking.But then, his mom saw a puddle. She pointed to it and said, "John, do you want to lead?". John was excited! He ran ahead to the puddle, and his mom followed.John stepped in the middle of the puddle, and he looked very proud. He smiled at his mom and said, "I'm leading mommy, see?". His mom smiled back and said, "You certainly are John. You look like a brave leader". John laughed and splashed around in the wet puddle. He finally was getting to lead!
Original Summary: John, feeling envious of leading, was given the opportunity by his mom to lead the way across a puddle, which he proudly did, smiling and splashing in the water.

Original Story: Lily likes to help her mom with the mail. Every day, they walk to the big box and get the letters and papers. Lily likes to look at the pictures and colors on the envelopes. Sometimes, there is a card or a sticker for her.One day, Lily saw a red envelope with her name on it. She was very happy and opened it. Inside, there was a card from her grandma. Grandma said she missed Lily and sent her a gift. Lily looked and saw a small bag of candy. She loved candy!Lily wanted to eat the candy right away, but mom said to wait until after lunch. Lily was hungry, so she agreed. Mom made sandwiches and soup for lunch. Lily chose the cheese sandwich and the tomato soup. She liked cheese and tomatoes.She ate her sandwich and then took a spoon of soup. But the soup was very spicy! It made her mouth burn and her eyes water. She did not like spicy soup. She coughed and cried. Mom gave her some water and a hug. She said she was sorry and did not know the soup was spicy.Lily felt better and smiled. She said it was okay and asked for her candy. Mom said yes and gave her the bag. Lily opened it and saw different colors of candy. She chose a green one and put it in her mouth. But the candy was also spicy! It was even spicier than the soup. It made her tongue hurt and her nose run. She spit out the candy and screamed. Mom looked at the bag and saw a picture of a pepper. She said the candy was a joke from grandma. Grandma liked spicy things and wanted to make Lily laugh.Lily did not laugh. She was very mad and sad. She did not like spicy things or jokes. She threw the bag of candy and the card in the trash. She said she did not like grandma anymore. Mom said that was not nice and that grandma loved her. She said she would call grandma and tell her the joke was not funny. She said she would also get Lily some new candy that was sweet and not spicy.Lily calmed down and said sorry. She said she loved grandma too, but not her candy. She hugged mom and said thank you. Mom hugged her back and said you're welcome. They went to the couch and read a book. Lily hoped the mail tomorrow would be better.
Original Summary: Lily helps her mom sort mail and receives a spicy candy gift from her grandma, which she does not enjoy, leading to a temporary rift between Lily and her grandma before they reconcile with a new, non-spicy candy gift.

Sarah exclaimed.While she was exploring, something miraculous happened. Suddenly, the tower started to become bigger and bigger. The blocks became bigger and softer. Sarah was so excited!She started to climb the tower and soon she was up very high. From the top she could see the entire town! She was so proud of her accomplishment.Sarah smiled, realizing this was just the start of her magical journey!

But then, he remembered something his mother had told him. She said, "If you try hard enough, you can do anything."The little bird didn't give up. He tried and tried, and finally, he sprang out of his cage and flew to the tree. He felt so free and happy. And he realized that sometimes, we have to work hard to get what we want. The moral of the story is that if you keep trying, you can achieve your dreams.

Original Story: Lily was a lonely girl. She had no friends to play with. She only had her doll, Rose, who was her best friend. Lily loved Rose very much. She hugged her, talked to her, and dressed her every day.One day, Lily's mom said they had to move to a new house. Lily was sad. She did not want to leave her old house and her old room. She did not want to leave Rose behind. She asked her mom if she could take Rose with her. Her mom said no. She said Rose was too old and dirty. She said Lily had to send Rose away.Lily cried and cried. She did not want to send Rose away. She begged her mom to let her keep Rose. Her mom said no. She said Lily had to be a big girl and say goodbye to Rose. She said she would buy Lily a new doll in the new house.Lily had no choice. She had to send Rose away. She put Rose in a big box. She wrote "To Rose, I love you" on the box. She gave Rose one last hug and one last kiss. She said "I will miss you, Rose. You are my best friend."Lily's mom took the box and put it in the car. She drove away with Lily and the box. Lily looked out the window and saw the box get smaller and smaller. She felt a big hole in her heart. She felt very lonely.The box with Rose inside went to a big place with many other boxes. The people there did not care about Rose. They did not read the words on the box. They did not see the love in Rose's eyes. They did not feel the warmth in Rose's body. They threw the box in a big pile. The box was crushed and torn. Rose was broken and lost. She felt very lonely. She wished she could see Lily again. She wished she could hug Lily again. She wished she could be Lily's best friend again. But she could not. She was gone.
Original Summary: Lily was forced to send her beloved doll, Rose, away to a new home after her family moved, despite her pleas to keep her, resulting in Rose being lost and forgotten among many other boxes, leaving her feeling lonely and longing for her former best friend.

Original Story: Sam loved his bicycle. It was red and shiny and had a bell. He rode it every day to the park with his dad. He liked to go fast and make noise.One day, Sam hit a big rock on the road. His bicycle made a loud sound and stopped. Sam fell off and scraped his knee. He cried and looked at his bicycle. The wheel was bent and the chain was broken. He was very sad.His dad came and picked him up. He hugged him and said, "Don't worry, Sam. We can repair your bicycle. It's not too bad. Let's go home and get some tools."Sam sniffed and nodded. He hoped his dad was right. He loved his bicycle very much. He did not want a new one. His bicycle was a gift from his grandpa. His grandpa said it was expensive and special.At home, his dad worked hard to fix his bicycle. He used a hammer, a wrench and some oil. He straightened the wheel and fixed the chain. He wiped the dirt and dust. He checked the brakes and the bell. He smiled and said, "There you go, Sam. Your bicycle is good as new. Do you want to try it?"Sam ran to his bicycle and hugged it. He was very happy. He thanked his dad and said, "You are the best, dad. You can repair anything. I love you and I love my bicycle."He put on his helmet and got on his bicycle. He rang the bell and said, "Let's go to the park, dad. I want to show grandpa my bicycle. He will be proud of us."

Original Story: It was a very rainy day. The little girl was anxious, as she did not have an umbrella. She ran outside and saw her friend with an umbrella. She asked her friend if she could borrow it, but her friend resisted. She felt very sad. So she ran out into the rain and started to play. The raindrops hit her face and she laughed and smiled. She jumped in the puddles and went higher and higher. Suddenly, the rain stopped and the sun emerged. She looked around and saw a pink and purple umbrella. She ran over to it and opened it up. She shook it out and laughed as it tickled her skin. She felt very happy that she had found an umbrella and she ran home, twirling the umbrella around in the air. She smiled all the way home and hugged the umbrella tight. The little girl was no longer anxious, she was happy.

One day she found a secret hidden in the garden. She stopped spinning and peered around the corner. There was a big spinning wheel! It was starting to move around and around really quickly. She pushed the button and the wheel stopped spinning.She took the wheel for a spin around the garden. It was even better than spinning on her own. She spun and spun around in circles, until she felt dizzy and had to stop. That was the best spinning ever! The girl kept the hidden button special in her pocket, so she could spin around again soon.
