His mum was very pleased to see the milk and they all cuddled up together, enjoying the warm, milky drink.George was very happy again. He'd remembered how to make things better, even when things seemed gloomy!

Original Story: Sara and Ben are playing in the park. They see a big slide and run to it. Sara goes first. She slides down fast and laughs. Ben waits for his turn.But then he sees a man with a mask. The mask is scary. It has big teeth and red eyes. The man is holding a bag. He is running away from a woman. The woman is shouting."Stop! Stop! Give me back my purse!"Ben is afraid. He does not want to slide. He wants to hide. He runs to Sara and holds her hand."Sara, look! There is a bad man with a mask. He is crazy. He took a woman's purse. What do we do?"Sara looks at the man and the woman. She is brave. She has an idea."Ben, don't be scared. We can help. Let's make a loud noise. Maybe the woman can catch the man."Sara and Ben nod. They start to yell and clap. They make a lot of noise."Hey! Hey! Stop! Stop!"The man with the mask hears them. He turns around. He sees Sara and Ben. He is angry. He drops the bag and runs away.The woman sees the bag. She runs to it. She picks it up. She is happy. She sees Sara and Ben. She smiles."Thank you, thank you! You are very brave and smart. You helped me get my purse back. You are heroes!"Sara and Ben smile too. They are proud. They hug each other. They are happy. They go back to the slide. They have fun.
Original Summary: Sara and Ben, while playing in the park, witness a man with a scary mask stealing a woman's purse, but they bravely make a loud noise to distract him, causing him to drop the bag and run away, allowing the woman to retrieve her purse, and they are praised as heroes by the grateful woman.

Original Story: Lilly was so excited, because it was her birthday! Her mum had promised her a special birthday cake. Mum carefully brought the cake out from the kitchen. It was a lovely cake with pretty pink and white decorations. Lilly's eyes lit up as she said "wow, it looks delicious!" Mum smiled and said "it sure does, go ahead and blow out the candle!" Lilly carefully blew out the candle and suddenly the cake began to move. Lilly and her mum looked at each other in surprise. Suddenly the cake revealed a beautiful surprise - a shining gold necklace with a tiny heart! Lily gasped in surprise, and her mum said "it's for you, my lovely Lilly". Lilly was so happy and hugged her mum. She said thank you and put the necklace on. It was a lovely reminder of a very special birthday - one she would never forget!
Original Summary: Lilly was thrilled on her birthday when she blew out the candle on a delicious cake and discovered a hidden surprise - a shining gold necklace with a tiny heart - from her loving mother.

Original Story: Tommy was a very obedient boy. He liked to listen to his mommy and play outside in the garden. One sunny day, Tommy was playing with his toy cars when suddenly he heard an ambulance passing by. He was so excited to see it and wanted to win a ride!He ran to his mommy and said, "Mommy, can I please ride the ambulance?" She smiled and shook her head. "No, Tommy. We can't do that."Tommy was disappointed so he said, "Please, mommy? I want to win a ride in the ambulance!"His mommy said, "That's a very nice idea, Tommy, but you can't ride in an ambulance. You have to be very obedient and stay with me."Tommy nodded and said, "Okay, mommy. I'll be obedient." He smiled, knowing that even though he couldn't ride in the ambulance, he still felt like a winner.
Original Summary: Tommy, a well-behaved boy, was excited to see an ambulance passing by and asked his mommy for a ride, but she politely declined, emphasizing the importance of obedience and staying with her.

And from that day forward, the rabbit was very happy in its new home.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a jolly bear named Benny. Benny loved to play with his friends in the forest. One day, Benny and his friends were playing hide-and-seek when they heard a scary noise. "What was that?" Benny asked his friends. "I don't know," they replied. Suddenly, they saw a scary monster coming towards them. They were so scared that they ran away as fast as they could. Benny tripped and fell, hurting his paw. "Ouch!" he cried. His friend, Lucy, quickly got some tape and wrapped it around Benny's paw to make it feel better. "Thank you, Lucy," Benny said, feeling better. "You're welcome," Lucy replied. After they were all safe, they laughed and played together again. Benny realized that even though scary things can happen, he had his friends to help him and make everything better.
Original Summary: Benny the bear and his friends were playing hide-and-seek in the forest when they heard a scary noise and saw a monster approaching, causing them to run away and Benny to trip and hurt his paw, but with the help of his friend Lucy, who wrapped tape around his paw to make it feel better, they were able to laugh and play together again, realizing that even in scary situations, they had each other's backs.

He also made friends with many animals in the forest. The moral of the story is to always stay on the right path and not to worry because help will always come.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a brave little girl called Lina. She wanted to go on an adventure and explore a wild swamp. That made her very nervous, so she wrapped her favourite blanket around her shoulders and set off. On the way to the swamp, she met a friendly frog. He was hopping along looking for some food. The frog saw her blanket and asked if he could have it. But Lina knew she needed the blanket for when she got cold and said no. Then the frog suggested that they explore the swamp together. He told her he would look out for things that moved while she kept her eyes peeled for anything which looked interesting. Lina felt much less nervous and agreed to the plan. They waded through the swamp, eagerly looking at all sorts of strange things. Soon, Lina spotted a beautiful jewel sticking out of the ground. She was so excited, she carefully wrapped the jewel up and they headed home. The end.
Original Summary: A brave little girl named Lina embarked on an adventure in a wild swamp with a friendly frog, exploring strange things together while keeping an eye out for potential dangers, and eventually discovering a beautiful jewel.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little yellow bird. The bird lived in a tree by a well. Every day, the bird would fly around and sing songs. One day, a big storm came and the bird got scared. It flew into the well to hide. The bird was stuck in the well and couldn't get out. It tried to fly up, but it was too high. The bird was sad and lonely. Then, a kind person came by and saw the bird in the well. They knew just what to do. They shut the well and lifted the bird out. The bird was so happy to be free! It thanked the person and flew back to its tree. From then on, the bird was very careful around the well. It knew that it was a dangerous place to be. But it was grateful for the person who helped it when it was in trouble.
Original Summary: A little yellow bird lived in a tree near a well, but when a storm arrived, it got scared and flew into the well, getting stuck. A kind person saw the bird and rescued it, and the bird was grateful and more careful around the well afterward.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a little boy named Sam. Every morning Sam would march around his house, he was so proud that he could move around on his own! Sam loved his work and every day he marched even further and further.One day, he decided to march all the way to the beach. Sam was so excited he could hardly contain himself! He marched and marched until he became very, very sleepy.He decided he would take a rest, so he lay down in the sand. Sam dozed off and was in such a deep sleep, he didn't see the giant waves that were rolling onto the shore.Suddenly the waves were getting bigger and bigger and were about to overtake Sam! Luckily, his mother was nearby and ran over to scoop him up just in time.The moral of the story is that you should never be too adventurous and take a risk, because you never know what might happen! Always stay within the boundaries and keep a look out for danger.
Original Summary: A little boy named Sam was so proud of his ability to walk on his own, but his excitement to reach the beach led him to become too exhausted and nearly got him swept away by giant waves, teaching him to always be cautious and stay within safe boundaries.

Original Story: Jack was a 3 year old boy who wanted to go outside. But he had a difficult choice to make: should he take his bike or his scooter? He felt confused. He thought his bike was faster, but he liked the fun noises his scooter made. He examined the two vehicles carefully.Suddenly, the doorbell rang. Jack looked outside, and saw his friend, Jake. Jack was now even more confused. Should he choose his bike so he could catch up to Jake? Or should he pick his scooter so he could make funny noises with his friend?Jake kept ringing the doorbell, so Jack decided. He would take his bike so he could ride with Jake. He jumped on quickly, and shouted "Let's go!"The two friends rode around, having lots of laughs. Jack was glad he had chosen his bike, even though it had been difficult to decide.
Original Summary: Jack, a 3-year-old boy, was torn between taking his bike or scooter to go outside with his friend Jake, but ultimately chose his bike to keep up with Jake during their ride.

He examined the two vehicles carefully.Suddenly, the doorbell rang. Jack looked outside, and saw his friend, Jake. Jack was now even more confused. A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance. Should he choose his bike so he could catch up to Jake? Or should he pick his scooter so he could make funny noises with his friend?Jake kept ringing the doorbell, so Jack decided. He would take his bike so he could ride with Jake. He jumped on quickly, and shouted "Let's go!"The two friends rode around, having lots of laughs. Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little birdy. The birdy loved to sing and fly around. One day, the birdy was flying over the street when it saw a soft wormy. The birdy felt an urge to eat the wormy, but it remembered that it was not nice to eat other animals. So, the birdy flew away and found some seeds to eat instead. The end.
Original Summary: A little bird enjoyed singing and flying, but when it saw a worm, it hesitated to eat it due to a moral realization, opting instead to find seeds to eat.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a jolly time playing with her toys in her room. Suddenly, her mom came in and said, "Lily, it's time to finish playing and get ready for bed."Lily replied, "But mommy, I don't want to finish playing yet. Can I have just a few more minutes?"Her mom smiled and said, "Okay, you can have five more minutes. But don't forget to put your toys away and fluff your pillow before you go to sleep."Lily happily played for five more minutes and then put her toys away. She fluffed her pillow and climbed into bed. As she closed her eyes, she whispered to her mom, "Goodnight mommy, I had a jolly time playing today."

Original Story: One day, Daisy was feeling very anxious. She couldn't figure out why it felt like something was wrong. She blinked her eyes, feeling a little bit scared.Then, she heard a noise coming from the left. She looked around but couldn't see anything. She blinked again, feeling even more anxious now. When she heard the noise again, Daisy slowly crept towards it. Suddenly, she saw a little squirrel! It was looking for food in her garden. Daisy was so surprised that she almost fell over!Still feeling a bit anxious, Daisy stepped a bit closer to the squirrel. When she got closer, it ran away. Daisy had to take a deep breath and blink her eyes a few times to calm down again. She was starting to realize that the noise must have been the squirrel all along. She was glad that it wasn't anything dangerous. Daisy smiled and went back inside, feeling much less anxious now.
Original Summary: Daisy was startled by a noise in her garden, initially fearing something was wrong, but upon investigation, she discovered a small squirrel searching for food, which caused her to feel relieved and less anxious.

He saw Anna playing with Lily on the sofa."Hello, Anna," he said. "Can I sit with you?""Yes, daddy," Anna said. "This is Lily. She is my baby."Anna moved over and made room for her daddy. He smiled and sat down. He took Lily from Anna and looked at her."She is very pretty," he said. "Can I rock her too?"Anna nodded. She liked to share with her daddy. He was very careful with Lily. He rocked her gently and hummed a tune.Anna snuggled next to her daddy and watched him. She felt happy and safe. She loved her daddy and Lily very much. She closed her eyes and fell asleep.
Original Summary: Anna enjoyed playing with her favorite doll Lily, which her daddy, a lawyer, appreciated and even wanted to rock, making Anna feel happy and safe.

Original Story: Once upon a time, a young engine named Jimmy was the most reliable engine in the world. Every day, he would remind the other engines of their responsibilities, and was always around to lend a helping hand. Despite this, his fellow engines didn't show him much respect, and usually scorned him for being young.One day, Jimmy was sent out to deliver some fuel to the nearby village, but he was running late. When he arrived, he encountered a flood and quickly realized that the only way to get over it was to use a bridge to the other side. Jimmy asked his fellow engines for help, but no one would listen. As the night sky began to darken, the village was in danger and Jimmy knew he needed to make a decision. With no other alternative, Jimmy used the bridge to get to the other side, even though it was much too heavy for him. All of the engines were in shock, but the village was saved.Jimmy reminded the other engines that they should never be too proud to ask for help. Acting responsibly and helping others can often be the best way to show courage and make a difference. From that day forward, the other engines began to view Jimmy with more respect.
Original Summary: Jimmy, the most reliable engine in the world, used a bridge to save a nearby village despite being too heavy for him, earning the respect of his fellow engines who had previously scorned him for being young.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and explore. One day, Timmy went on an adventure to a planet far, far away. The planet was very different from Earth. It was full of colorful rocks and funny-looking creatures. Timmy explored the planet for hours and had so much fun. But then, he realized it was getting late and he needed to go home. He met a friendly alien who offered to help him find his way back. The alien said, "Let's tidy up your spaceship before we end our adventure. It's important to keep our planet clean." Timmy agreed and they quickly cleaned up the spaceship. As they were flying back to Earth, Timmy said to the alien, "Thank you for helping me. This was the best adventure ever!" The alien replied, "I'm glad you had fun. Come back and visit us soon!" And with that, their adventure ended and Timmy went home with a big smile on his face.
Original Summary: Timmy, a curious boy, embarked on an intergalactic adventure to a colorful planet filled with strange creatures, explored for hours, and returned home with the help of a friendly alien who emphasized the importance of space cleanliness.

She sees Lily and Ben."Mom, we found a huge squash!" Lily says."Can we have it?" Ben says.Mom smiles. She is not angry."That is a nice squash. But it is not ready yet. It needs more time to grow. You can help me water it," Mom says."Okay, Mom," Lily and Ben say.They put the squash back. They get a hose. They water the squash. They are happy. They hope the squash will grow bigger and bigger.

Don't worry, I'll always be here to comfort you when you're feeling sad."Lily learned that her mommy was always kind and would always be there to help her. Original Story: Once upon a time, there was an old man who lived by the sea. Every day, he would go for a walk on the beach and watch the tide go in and out. One day, he found a little crab stuck in a rock pool. The crab wanted to go back into the sea but couldn't get out.The old man wanted to help the crab but he wasn't sure if it was okay to touch it. He asked himself, "Does the crab permit me to pick it up?" After thinking for a while, he decided that it was okay to help the crab. He gently picked up the crab and put it back into the sea.The crab was very happy and waved its claws to say thank you. From that day on, the old man always looked out for creatures that needed his help. And every day, he would watch the tide go in and out, knowing that he had done something good for the little crab.
Original Summary: An old man found a crab stuck in a rock pool and, after considering whether it was okay to touch it, gently picked it up and returned it to the sea, making the crab happy and inspiring the old man to continue helping other creatures in need.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park with her friends. One day, while they were playing, they saw a police car drive by with its siren on. Lily asked her friend, "What is the police?" Her friend replied, "They help people when they're in trouble." Suddenly, they heard a distant sound. It was coming from a box that was left on the ground. Lily's friend said, "Let's open it!" But Lily was scared and said, "No, we should ask the police for help." So they went to the police station and told the officers about the box. The police opened it and inside was a lost puppy. The puppy was so happy to be found and Lily and her friends were happy to have helped.
Original Summary: A little girl named Lily played in the park with her friends, saw a police car, and when they found a mysterious box, they went to the police station for help, leading to the discovery of a lost puppy.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Claire. Claire went to a festival, and it was very messy. She saw leaves and dirt everywhere; it looked very filthy.Claire started to examine the place. She saw a big, yellow puddle and a lot of green and brown leaves that were all mixed up. She saw a big tree with lots of bugs crawling around it.Claire couldn't believe how filthy the festival was! She started to pick up the leaves and the dirt, so that the place would look nice and clean again. She also saw a really cool butterfly, and a lot of other funny animals.When the festival was finished, Claire saw that the place was very clean, and she was very proud of herself. She had worked very hard to make the festival look nice again. From then on, she always examined her surrounding to make sure that everywhere she went was clean. The End.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys all day, but she never liked to clean up after herself. Her mom always told her to clean up, but she never listened.One day, Lily's uncle came to visit. He saw how messy her room was and asked her, "Why is your room so messy, Lily?"Lily replied, "I don't like to clean up, Uncle. It's boring."Uncle smiled and said, "I have an idea. I will provide you with a reward if you clean up your room."Lily was excited and asked, "What reward, Uncle?"Uncle replied, "I will take you to the park to play on the swings."Lily quickly cleaned up her room, and Uncle kept his promise. They went to the park, and Lily had so much fun on the swings. From that day on, Lily always cleaned up her room because she knew Uncle would provide her with a fun reward.
Original Summary: Lily, a little girl who dislikes cleaning, is motivated to tidy her room after her uncle promises a fun reward, such as taking her to the park to play on the swings.

Original Story: One beautiful winter morning, Little Fred was outside playing in the snow. The cold air made him shiver and his toes felt like ice cubes. Little Fred moved closer to his family's mailbox where the sun was shining. He decided to write his name in the snow.Suddenly, a dog began to bark from a nearby yard. Little Fred was scared and ran back to the safety of his house. On the way, he noticed the dog's white fence. It had a sign that said "Obedient Dog". Little Fred wasn't sure what the sign meant.The next morning, Little Fred put on his warmest jacket and went outside again. He was determined to find out what the sign meant. When he arrived at the mailbox, the dog was there waiting for him. Little Fred was scared at first, but soon he realized that the dog was friendly! He had been trained to always stay close to the mailbox.Little Fred was amazed! From then on, he knew that the "Obedient Dog" had been shivering in the cold to keep him safe. Every time Little Fred was outside, the dog was there to guard him.
Original Summary: Little Fred was playing in the snow when a barking dog scared him, but the next day he returned to find a friendly dog guarding the mailbox, which had a sign saying "Obedient Dog."

Lily was so happy and couldn't wait to show her new pet to her friends.

Original Story: Molly and Sam were best friends. Every day they'd join hands and play in the park.But one day there was a problem. Molly asked, "Where are we going to meet today?"Sam replied, "Let's go to the empty cell. It's a fun place to play!" Molly nodded with excitement and they joined hands and headed out. When they arrived, the cell was empty. But back in the corner, they heard a low rumbling sound. Molly and Sam stayed where they were and peeked around the corner. The rumbling sound got louder. Suddenly, a huge creature burst through the wall of the cell. It growled at Molly and Sam and jumped towards them. Molly and Sam screamed and ran away, but the creature was too fast. It caught them both in its claws and flew away.The two best friends never returned to the empty cell.
Original Summary: Molly and Sam, best friends who played in a park every day, were suddenly confronted with a monster in an empty cell they were told to meet at, and they were caught and taken away by the creature.

Original Story: Lily liked to draw with her pen. She had a blue pen and a red pen. She drew flowers and stars and houses. She liked to add more things to her drawings. She added a sun and a moon and a cat.One day, Lily saw a new pen in her mom's bag. It was a modern pen. It had a button and a light. Lily wanted to try it. She took the pen and pushed the button. The light turned on and made a sound. Lily was happy. She drew with the modern pen on her paper.But the modern pen was not a normal pen. It was a laser pen. It made holes in the paper. Lily did not know that. She added more holes to her drawing. She thought it was fun. She made a big hole in the middle of her paper.Mom saw what Lily did. She was not happy. She took the modern pen from Lily. She said, "This is not a pen for drawing. This is a pen for work. It is dangerous. You could hurt yourself or someone else. You should not take things from my bag without asking."Lily was sorry. She did not want to make mom angry. She did not want to hurt anyone. She said, "I'm sorry, mom. I did not know. I just wanted to draw with the modern pen. It was shiny and pretty."Mom hugged Lily. She said, "I know, sweetie. But you have to be careful with things you don't know. Some things are not for kids. You can draw with your blue pen and your red pen. They are safe and nice. And you can add anything you want to your drawings. They are beautiful and creative."Lily smiled. She said, "Thank you, mom. I love you. Can I draw you a flower with my blue pen and my red pen?"Mom said, "Of course, Lily. I would love that. You are a good artist. And a good daughter."
Original Summary: Lily drew with her blue and red pens, but when she found a new pen in her mom's bag, she accidentally used it to make holes in her drawing, causing her mom to take it away and teach her about being careful with new things.

She had been practicing for weeks, and her orange tutu was perfectly complete. Just as Sara was about to start her dance, her brother John came into the room and spoiled it all. "You're dancing too slow!" John yelled. Sara was very upset. She had worked so hard and wanted to make her parents proud. She looked to her parents, hoping they would tell John to stop."John, how about you dance too?" Mom suggested. John thought about it for a few moments, then grabbed his hat and ran to the living room. Sara smiled, glad to have her moment again. She did her best and the performance was a hit! John cheered the loudest of all. Sara and John hugged each other, happy to have shared a moment together. They knew that, with a little help, nothing can spoil their dreams.

Original Story: One day a boy was walking through the park with his mum. He saw a penny on the ground and shouted "Mum, look!" His mum said, "That's a penny!" His mum said, "We can buy something with it!" She thought for a moment, then smiled. She said, "We can make a toy boat with it!"The boy loved this idea and they went to a shop. They looked at the toy boats and saw one that was flexible. It could float in the river, making it perfect! They took the penny out of the purse and paid for the boat.The boy was so happy and wanted to play with it straight away. He ran to the river and put the boat in the water. He said to his mum, "Look! It floats!" His mum smiled and said, "Yes, it does!"

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Fluffy. Fluffy was very furry and loved to play with his toys. One day, Fluffy's mom asked him to help with the dishes. Fluffy didn't like doing dishes, but he wanted to make his mom happy, so he said "okay".As Fluffy was putting the dishes in the dishwasher, he heard a whistle outside. He ran to the window and saw his friend, a little bird, sitting on a branch. The bird said, "Fluffy, come play with me!" Fluffy wanted to go play, but he knew he had to finish the dishes first.After he finished, Fluffy went outside to play with his friend. The bird said, "Fluffy, you did a good job helping your mom. That was very kind of you." Fluffy felt happy that he had helped his mom and his friend was proud of him too.The moral of the story is that it's important to help others, even if it's not always fun. And, it's always good to take a break and play with your friends after you finish your work.
Original Summary: Fluffy, a little cat, helps his mom with the dishes despite not wanting to, then goes outside to play with his friend afterward, learning the importance of helping others and taking breaks.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a huge planet. That planet was called Earth and it was in trouble. Earth was very sick and no one could figure out how to heal it.One day, a 3 year old child went to the planet and saw how sick it was. He was so sad and he said: "Earth needs help! He asked: "Are you a magical star?"The star replied: "Yes, I am. I will help you heal the planet with my magical powers." The child was so excited! He wished on the star and in a twinkle the planet was healed. The child jumped for joy and said: "Hooray! The planet is huge and healthy again!" Happy and content, the child went home with a smile on his face. The end.

Original Story: Once there was a bee named Mandy who lived in a fancy hive. Every day Mandy loved to bake yummy treats and then share them with the other bees in the hive. One day, Mandy decided to bake something extra special - something fancy. She got all the ingredients and mixed them together in a big bowl. Then she put the mix in a special mould which she had found. Mandy put the mould in the oven and waited for it to bake.When the timer went off, Mandy took the treat out of the oven and it smelt and looked very fancy! All the other bees in the hive were so excited that they gathered around to have a look. Mandy passed the tasty treat around and everyone enjoyed it.The bees kept asking Mandy to make more fancy treats so she decided to become a baker! Mandy became known in the hive as the best baker. Every bee loved to try the fancy treats she made. And Mandy was very happy that she could make everyone happy with her baking skills.
Original Summary: Mandy, a bee with a passion for baking, creates a fancy treat in a special mold and shares it with her hive, becoming known as the best baker and making everyone happy with her delicious creations.

Original Story: Once there was a little girl who loved to draw pictures. She spent hours and hours making them for the people she loved. One day the girl was feeling very guilty. She had done something wrong and knew she needed to make it right. That's when she had an idea.The little girl decided to take a picture she had drawn and deliver it to the special person she wanted to apologize to. She gathered up supplies and carefully drew the pretty picture. Once it was finished she was so pleased with it. She quickly folded it up and put it in an envelope with a note saying "I'm sorry". Then it was time to deliver it.The little girl walked up the steps and knocked on the door. When the person answered the door she took a deep breath, smiled and handed them the envelope. The person thanked her with a big hug and an even bigger smile. The little girl felt relieved and smiled with joy! From then on she knew that when she needed to say she was sorry, a picture could be the perfect way to say it.
Original Summary: A little girl apologized to a special person she wronged by delivering a handmade picture with a heartfelt note, feeling relieved and joyful after seeing the person's grateful response.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a tall squirrel named Sammy. Sammy loved to climb trees and eat nuts. One day, Sammy saw a big river and wanted to swim in it. Sammy asked his friend, a bird named Billy, "Do you want to swim with me?" But Billy was scared of the water and said, "No, I can't swim. I'm afraid." Sammy tried to convince Billy that swimming was fun and safe, but Billy still refused. So, Sammy decided to swim alone. As Sammy was swimming, he saw a fish caught in a net. Sammy knew he had to help the fish, so he used his sharp teeth to cut the net and set the fish free. The fish thanked Sammy and they became friends. From that day on, Sammy and the fish would swim together in the river and have lots of fun. And Billy learned that sometimes it's good to try new things, even if they seem scary at first.
Original Summary: Sammy, a tall squirrel, convinced his fearful friend Billy to try swimming in a river, but when Billy refused, Sammy swam alone and rescued a fish caught in a net, making a new friend in the process.

Original Story: Once there was a little rabbit called Mike. He lived in a village far far away. He was always very curious and liked to explore. One day he thought he would explore the woods nearby.He had a wonderful time bouncing through the trees, but soon he got very tired. So he decided to take a little rest and crawl under a bush to take a nap.But as he crawled under the bush he suddenly heard loud noises. It was a wolf! The wolf was growling and looking very angry. Mike was very scared and tried to run away, but it was too late. The wolf chased him until they reached the edge of the village.Suddenly, some of the villagers heard the commotion and looked out to see what was happening. When they saw the wolf, they quickly came out and shouted to scare it away. But it was too late - the wolf had already grabbed Mike and was running away with him.The villagers were very sad and the little rabbit was never seen again.

Original Story: Ben and Tom are brothers. They like to play with their toys. They have many toys, but their favorite is the big red automobile. The automobile can move very fast and make loud noises. Ben and Tom pretend they are drivers and race each other.One day, they see a hairy dog outside their window. The dog is big and black and has a long tail. Ben and Tom want to pet the dog. They think the dog is friendly and cute. They run to the door and open it. They forget to ask their mom.The dog sees Ben and Tom. The dog does not like strangers. The dog barks and growls. The dog is angry and scared. The dog runs to Ben and Tom. The dog bites Ben on the leg. Ben screams and cries. Tom is afraid and runs back to the house. He calls for mom.Mom hears Tom and Ben. She runs to the door and sees the dog. She is shocked and worried. She grabs a broom and chases the dog away. She picks up Ben and hugs him. She sees the blood on his leg. She calls for help.Ben and Tom are sad and hurt. They do not want to play with the dog anymore. They do not want to play with the automobile either. They wish they had listened to their mom. They say they are sorry. Mom says she loves them. She takes them to the doctor. The doctor gives Ben a bandage and a shot. The doctor says Ben will be okay. Ben and Tom hope the dog will be okay too. They learn a lesson. They never open the door without asking mom again.
Original Summary: Ben and Tom, two brothers, play with their toys, including a favorite big red automobile, but their fun is interrupted when they encounter a hairy black dog that bites Ben on the leg, causing them to run back to the house and seek their mother's help.

Original Story: Once there was a mommy who was very upset. She was so upset that she was sorting through her clothes. Her daughter came into the room and asked, "Mommy, why are you so upset?" Mommy sighed, "I don't want to tell you, but it's because Daddy had to go away."The little girl's eyes filled with tears and she said, "Can I help you with your clothes?" It seemed that nothing was ever going to make her happy again.

Original Story: Tom and Anna were twins who liked to play in their room. They had many toys and books and games, but sometimes they got bored. One day, they had an idea. They wanted to make a big painting on the ceiling.They took some paint and brushes from their dad's workshop and climbed on their beds. They started to draw and color on the white ceiling. They made flowers and stars and animals and faces. They had fun and did not hear their mom calling them for lunch."Tom, Anna, come downstairs, it's time to eat!" their mom shouted from the kitchen. But they did not answer. They wanted to finish their painting. They delayed going to the kitchen.Their mom got worried and went upstairs. She opened their door and gasped. She saw the mess on the ceiling and on the beds and on the floor. She saw the paint and the brushes and the twins. She was very angry and sad."Tom, Anna, what have you done?" she asked in a loud voice. "You have ruined the ceiling and the beds and the floor. You have wasted the paint and the brushes. You have disobeyed me and ignored me. How could you do this?"Tom and Anna looked at their mom and felt guilty. They knew they had done something bad. They did not mean to hurt their mom or their room. They just wanted to have fun. But they realized they had made a big mistake.They dropped their brushes and ran to their mom. They hugged her and said they were sorry. They said they loved her and they would help her clean the mess. They said they would never do it again.Their mom hugged them back and said she loved them too. She said she was glad they were sorry and they wanted to help. She said they would have to work hard to fix the ceiling and the beds and the floor. She said they would have to learn to respect their things and their rules. She said they would have to be more careful and responsible.Tom and Anna nodded and said they understood. They followed their mom downstairs and ate their lunch. Then they went back upstairs and started to clean the mess. They worked hard and felt sorry. They learned their lesson.The moral of the story is: Do not delay doing what you are supposed to do. Do not ruin what you have. Do not disobey or ignore your parents. Do not make a mess. Be careful and responsible. Say sorry and help when you do something wrong.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a big bear who lived in the forest. The bear was very playful and loved to play with his friends. One day, he met a little rabbit who was carrying a big piece of lumber. The bear asked the rabbit, "What are you doing with that big stick?" The rabbit replied, "I am taking it to my house to build a new bed." The bear was curious and asked, "Can I help you carry it?" The rabbit was happy and said, "Yes, please!" While they were walking, the bear asked the rabbit if he wanted to play with him. The rabbit replied, "Sure, let's play hide and seek!" They arrived at the rabbit's house and the bear helped him build the new bed. After they finished, the bear said, "Thank you for letting me help you. I had fun playing with you!" The rabbit smiled and said, "Thank you for helping me. You are a good friend. We should play together again soon!" The bear replied, "Yes, we should. It was nice to speak with you and help you with your lumber." They hugged each other and said goodbye, looking forward to their next playful adventure together.
Original Summary: A big bear and a little rabbit became friends after the bear helped the rabbit build a new bed, and they played hide and seek together before saying goodbye and looking forward to their next adventure.

The rabbit replied, "Sure, let's play hide and seek!" They arrived at the rabbit's house and the bear helped him build the new bed. After they finished, the bear said, "Thank you for letting me help you. I had fun playing with you!" The rabbit smiled and said, "Thank you for helping me. You are a good friend. We should play together again soon!" The bear replied, "Yes, we should. It was nice to speak with you and help you with your lumber." They hugged each other and said goodbye, looking forward to their next playful adventure together. Octopuses have three hearts.

Original Story: Tom and Sam are friends. They like to play with their bikes. One day, Tom's bike has a problem. The wheel is broken. It has a big hole."Oh no, my bike is bad!" Tom says. He is sad."Don't worry, Tom. We can repair it," Sam says. He is smart. He has a tool box.Sam gets his tool box and looks for a patch. A patch is a small piece of rubber. He puts the patch on the hole and glues it. Then he pumps air into the wheel."There, it is done. Your bike is good again," Sam says. He is happy."Wow, thank you, Sam. You are a great friend. You make it look easy," Tom says. He is grateful.They hug and smile. Then they ride their bikes together. They have fun. The end.
Original Summary: Tom's bike gets a flat tire, but his friend Sam repairs it with a patch and air, making it good as new, and Tom is grateful for Sam's help.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a dog. He had four soft, furry paws. One of the paws was not like the others. It was not white or brown like the other paws. He would wrap it around his bowl and carry it around the room. He would wrap it around sticks and run with them. He would try and wrap it around the cat, but that never worked. The dog loved his sparkly silver paw. He liked to show it off to all the other animals. Everyone thought it was very special. The end.

Original Story: Mia was a young girl who liked to play with her toys. She had a doll, a bear, a ball and a car. She made them talk to each other and have fun. She also liked to draw with her crayons and make pictures for her mom and dad.One day, Mia was playing with her toys in her room. She heard her mom call her from the kitchen. "Mia, it's time for dinner. Come and wash your hands, please." Mia put her toys away and ran to the kitchen. She saw her mom had made her favorite food: pasta with cheese and broccoli. She smiled and said, "Thank you, mom. I love pasta."Mia ate her dinner and drank her milk. She told her mom and dad about her toys and her drawings. They listened and praised her. They also told her stories and jokes. Mia laughed and felt happy. She loved her mom and dad.After dinner, Mia helped her mom clear the table and put the dishes in the sink. Then she brushed her teeth and put on her pajamas. She hugged her mom and dad and said, "Good night, I love you." They hugged her back and said, "We love you too, Mia. Sweet dreams."Mia went to her room and climbed into her bed. She took her bear and cuddled with it. She felt warm and cozy. She closed her eyes and thought about her toys and her drawings. She also thought about her mom and dad and how they made her feel. She smiled and fell asleep. She had a good day.

Original Story: Lily was a lonely flower. She lived in a big garden with many other flowers, but they did not talk to her. They said she was too small and too plain. Lily wished she could grow big and beautiful like them.One day, a kind lady came to the garden. She saw Lily and smiled. She said, "You are a lovely flower. You have a special cap that protects you from the sun and the rain. Do you know what kind of flower you are?"Lily shook her head. She did not know."You are a poppy, my dear. And you have a secret. When the time is right, your cap will fall off and you will show your bright red petals to the world. You will be the most dazzling flower in the garden."Lily felt happy and hopeful. She thanked the kind lady and waited for her cap to fall off.The next morning, Lily felt a tickle on her head. She looked up and saw her cap was loose. She gave a gentle push and it fell to the ground. She felt a breeze on her face and opened her eyes. She gasped. She saw her red petals shining in the sun. She was beautiful.She heard the other flowers whispering and admiring her. They came closer and said hello. They asked her to join them and play. Lily smiled and nodded. She was not lonely anymore. She had friends.The moral of the story is: Don't judge a flower by its cap. Everyone has something special inside.
Original Summary:  when the time is right, her cap will fall off and reveal her bright red petals, making her the most dazzling flower in the garden.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a big puddle outside. It was so big it filled the entire yard. Jimmy wanted to play with the puddle, so he grabbed his bucket and scoop. He ran outside and put his bucket in the middle of the puddle. Jimmy started rolling it around in the puddle. He pushed it back and forth and spun it around. The water splashed with each roll and it made Jimmy giggle. He could feel how cool the water was and how slippery his bucket was. Jimmy rolled the bucket around the puddle for what felt like forever. He had so much fun that he didn't want to stop. Eventually, though, Jimmy got tired and remembered he needed to go inside for dinner. As he left, he gave one last look at the big puddle and smiled. Roll-ing was so much fun!

Original Story: Anna and Ben are friends who like to swim in the sea. They have masks and fins to see the fish and the reef. The reef is a place where many fish live and play. It has many colors and shapes.One day, Anna and Ben swim to the reef and see a big fish. It is blue and yellow and has a long nose. Anna and Ben are curious and want to get closer. They try to swim near the big fish, but it is shy and swims away."Let's try again," Anna says to Ben. "Maybe it will let us see it."They try again and again, but the big fish always swims away. Anna and Ben are sad and tired. They decide to swim back to the shore.On the way back, they see a small fish. It is green and orange and has a round mouth. It swims up to Anna and Ben and makes a funny noise. It sounds like "blub blub"."Hello, little fish," Anna says to the small fish. "What is your name?"The small fish makes the noise again and wiggles its tail. It seems to like Anna and Ben. It follows them to the shore and stays with them.Anna and Ben are happy and grateful. They have made a new friend. They give the small fish some bread and water. They tell it stories and jokes. They laugh and play with the small fish.The small fish is happy and grateful, too. It has made new friends. It likes the bread and water. It likes the stories and jokes. It laughs and plays with Anna and Ben.Anna and Ben and the small fish are friends who like to swim in the sea. They have masks and fins to see the fish and the reef. The reef is a place where many fish live and play. It has many colors and shapes. And it has a big fish and a small fish who are very different but very special.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the grocery store with her mom. Lily told her about the cereal and how much she cared about the character.The lady smiled and said, "I think I can help you." She went to the back of the store and came back with a box of the cereal, saying it was on sale. Lily was so happy and thanked the lady.The moral of the story is that sometimes people care about things that are important to them, and it's nice when others help them out.

Original Story: Tom and Sam were brothers who liked to play near the river. They had a raft that they made from wood and rope. They used the raft to go across the water and have fun.One day, they saw a big hole in their raft. The water was coming in and the raft was sinking. Tom and Sam were scared and sad."Who did this to our raft?" Tom asked."Maybe it was the bad boys from the other side. They are always mean to us." Sam said."We have to repair our raft. We need more wood and rope." Tom said.They looked around and saw a pile of wood and rope near the river. It belonged to the bad boys. They had their own raft, but it was bigger and stronger than Tom and Sam's."Let's take some of their wood and rope. They won't notice." Sam said."No, that is not right. That is stealing. We have to ask them first." Tom said."But they will say no. They will laugh at us and call us names." Sam said."Maybe they will, but we have to be honest and kind. Maybe they will be nice to us if we are nice to them." Tom said.Tom and Sam went to the bad boys and asked them if they could borrow some of their wood and rope. The bad boys were surprised and curious."Why do you want our wood and rope?" one of them asked."Our raft has a hole and we need to repair it. Please, can you help us?" Tom said.The bad boys looked at each other and then at Tom and Sam. They saw that they were telling the truth and that they were polite and brave."OK, you can have some of our wood and rope. But you have to promise to return them when you are done." another one said."Thank you, thank you. We promise to return them." Tom and Sam said.They took some of the wood and rope and went back to their raft. They worked hard and fixed the hole. They were happy and proud.They returned the wood and rope to the bad boys and thanked them again. The bad boys smiled and nodded."Hey, do you want to try our raft? It is fast and fun." one of them said."Really? Can we?" Tom and Sam said."Sure, why not? We can be friends." another one said.Tom and Sam and the bad boys went on the big raft and had a great time. They laughed and played and forgot their differences.The moral of the story is: honesty and kindness are better than stealing and fighting. You can make friends with anyone if you are respectful and generous.
Original Summary: Tom and Sam, two brothers, repaired their raft after a hole was made by unknown means, and they borrowed wood and rope from mean boys who initially refused but later agreed after seeing their honesty and kindness.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a girl. She wanted to play in the garden. She grabbed her spade and went outside. She started to dig and put the soil in a pile. The girl was very happy.A rabbit was hopping around near the pile. When it saw the pile of dirt, it thought it could make it into a hole. So it started to squeeze the pile and make a hole.The girl saw this. She was angry because she wanted to use the pile for herself. She shouted at the rabbit.She told the rabbit to stop being selfish and leave the pile alone. The rabbit was scared and it ran away. The girl smiled and she started to use her spade again. She was happy that the rabbit had left and she could make the pile as she wanted.
Original Summary: A girl wanted to play in the garden and started digging, but a rabbit thought the pile of dirt could be used for a hole and tried to squeeze it, causing the girl to become angry and chase it away so she could continue digging.

Original Story: Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They liked to pretend they were a queen and a knight. Lily had a crown made of flowers and Ben had a sword made of sticks."Queen Lily, I will protect you from the dragons and the robbers," Ben said."Thank you, knight Ben. You are very brave and strong," Lily said.They had a lot of fun, until they saw a big, slimy snail on a leaf. Lily and Ben did not like snails. They thought they were disgusting."Yuck! Look at that snail! It is so gross!" Lily said."Let's get rid of it! Maybe we can throw it over the fence," Ben said.They picked up the snail with a stick and tried to toss it away. But the snail was sticky and did not fly very far. It landed on Lily's crown and made it wet and dirty."Ah! The snail is on my crown! Help me, help me!" Lily screamed.Ben tried to help her, but he was scared of the snail too. He dropped his sword and ran away.Lily was very sad and angry. She took off her crown and threw it on the ground. She did not want to play queen and knight anymore. She wanted to go inside and wash her hair.The snail did not care. It crawled away and found another leaf to eat. It was happy and full.
Original Summary: Lily and Ben were playing in the garden, with Lily pretending to be a queen and Ben a knight, but they were interrupted by a slimy snail that landed on Lily's crown and made it wet and dirty, causing Lily to become sad and angry and want to stop playing.

Original Story: Ben and Lily were twins who liked to play outside. One day, they found a big hole in the ground. They wanted to see what was inside, so they climbed down the hole. They saw many things that were different from what they knew. There were bugs, rocks, roots, and dirt. They observed everything with curiosity and wonder.But they did not see the sign that said "Danger! Do not enter!" The hole was part of a construction site, and it was not safe for children. Soon, they heard a loud noise and felt the ground shake. It was a big machine that was digging more holes. The machine did not see Ben and Lily, and it was getting closer to them.Ben and Lily were scared and wanted to go back up. But the hole was too deep and dark, and they could not find the way. They cried and shouted for help, but no one heard them. They wished they had listened to their mom, who always told them to stay away from strange places.Luckily, a worker saw the sign and went to check the hole. He saw Ben and Lily and quickly pulled them out. He was angry and told them how dangerous it was to go underground without permission. He took them to their mom, who was very worried and relieved. She hugged them and thanked the worker. She also scolded them and told them to never do that again.Ben and Lily learned a lesson that day. They realized that being curious was good, but being careful was better. They promised to obey their mom and to respect the signs. They still liked to observe different things, but only from a safe distance. They were happy to be back on the ground, where they belonged.
Original Summary: Ben and Lily, curious twins, explored a deep hole they found in the ground but were trapped and scared until a worker rescued them, teaching them the importance of being careful and obeying signs.

Original Story: Once there was an old robot. He was a very friendly robot, always ready to help where he could. One day, the robot was out for a walk when he saw something strange. There was a small insect stuck in a spider's web. The robot noticed the insect was scared. The robot decided to help by striking the web. He aimed at the web and used his strength to make a big rip. The insect was freed! The insect was very happy to be free and thanked the old robot. They said goodbye and the robot continued on his walk. The robot had done a good deed and felt good inside. He knew that he had managed to help the insect and was proud.
Original Summary: An old robot helped a scared insect escape from a spider's web by using his strength to rip it, freeing the insect and earning its gratitude.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a clever little girl named Lily. One day, Lily was playing with her favorite button. She loved to hold it in her hand and feel its smooth surface.Suddenly, her little brother came and snatched the button from her hand. "No, mine!" he said.Lily tried to take it back, but her brother was too strong. So, she had an idea. "Hey, do you want to play a game?" she asked."What game?" her brother asked."The chewing game! We take turns chewing on the button, and whoever chews the longest wins!" Lily said.Her brother agreed, and they started chewing. But Lily was clever, and she knew that buttons weren't for chewing. So, she pretended to chew, but really she just held it in her mouth.After a few minutes, her brother spit out the button and said, "I can't chew anymore!"Lily smiled and said, "I win! And now, let's find something else to play with." They both laughed and found another toy to play with, happy and content.
Original Summary: Lily, a clever little girl, played a chewing game with her brother, pretending to chew a button while actually holding it in her mouth, and won the game by cheating.

Even though his car was wrecked, it still shone in the sun. From that day on, Timmy loved the color blue even more because it reminded him of his shiny car.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a cheerful little girl named Susy. She was walking down a path when she spotted a shadow peeking out from behind the trees. She was curious and wanted to know what it was. She slowly moved towards the shadow, but it seemed to disappear. As she got closer, she slowly realized the shadow was in the shape of a huge bear! Susy was scared and started to back away, but then she heard a voice. The bear said, "hey little girl, don't be scared. I am friendly. I just wanted to know if you wanted to play with me?" Surprised, Susy nodded her head yes. She said, "yes, I'd like to fit with you."The bear smiled and said, "Let's play hide and seek. I'll hide and you try to find me." Susy happily ran off to look for the bear. She looked behind trees and underneath rocks, but the bear was nowhere to be found. After a few minutes of searching, she heard the bear's voice coming from behind a bush. She ran to the bush and found the bear smiling at her. They laughed and hugged as Susy sat on the ground. The bear and Susy were best friends after that and they played together every day in the sunshine.
Original Summary: A cheerful little girl named Susy encountered a friendly bear while walking, who asked her to play hide and seek, and they became best friends after playing together every day.

Original Story: Lily and Tom were friends. They liked to play outside in the snow. One day, they saw a big mountain of snow near their house. They wanted to climb it and slide down."Let's go to the mountain!" Lily said."OK!" Tom said.They ran to the mountain and started to climb. It was hard. The snow was thick and cold. They slipped and fell many times. But they did not give up. They wanted to reach the top.They were almost there when they heard a loud noise. It was a snow plow. It was coming to clear the road. It was also coming to the mountain."Look out!" Lily shouted. "The plow is here!"They were scared. They did not want to be hit by the plow. They did not want to lose their mountain. They had to get down fast.They lay down on their bellies and slid down the mountain. They went very fast. They felt the wind in their faces. They screamed and laughed.They reached the bottom just in time. The plow passed by and took away some of the snow from the mountain. But not all of it. There was still enough for them to play.They got up and hugged each other. They were happy. They were safe. They had fun."Let's do it again!" Tom said."OK!" Lily said.They ran back to the mountain and climbed again. They did not care about the plow. They only cared about their adventure.
Original Summary: Lily and Tom, eager to play in the snow, climbed a big mountain near their house, but were scared when a snow plow appeared, so they slid down fast and reached the bottom just in time, happy and safe, and eager to do it again.

Original Story: Tom and Anna are playing with their toys on the floor. They have cars, dolls, blocks and a big ball. They make noises and pretend to have fun adventures."Look, Anna, my car can go very fast!" Tom says. He pushes his car along the floor and makes a zoom sound."Wow, Tom, your car is cool!" Anna says. She picks up her doll and makes her wave at the car. "Hello, car, do you want to play with me?"But then, the ball rolls away from them and goes under the sofa. Tom and Anna want to get the ball back, but they cannot reach it. The sofa is too big and the space under it is too deep."Mom, mom, can you help us?" Tom and Anna shout. They stand up and look for their mom.Mom hears them and comes to the living room. She sees the ball under the sofa and smiles."Did you lose your ball, kids?" she asks. She bends down and tries to get the ball out. But the ball is stuck and she cannot pull it."Oh, no, the ball is too deep under the sofa!" she says. "We need something to get it out. What can we use?"Tom and Anna think hard. They look around the room and see their toys on the floor. They have an idea."I know, I know!" Tom says. He runs to get his car and gives it to mom. "You can use my car, mom. It has wheels and it can go under the sofa.""Good idea, Tom!" mom says. She takes the car and slides it under the sofa. She pushes the car until it touches the ball. Then she pulls the car and the ball together. The ball comes out of the deep space and rolls to Tom and Anna."Yay, we got the ball back!" Tom and Anna cheer. They hug mom and thank her. Then they go back to the floor and play with their toys again. They are happy.
Original Summary: Tom and Anna play with their toys on the floor, including cars, dolls, blocks, and a big ball. They have fun pretending to have adventures, but when the ball rolls under the sofa, they need their mom's help to get it out.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a toy truck that he loved to play with. One day, the truck broke and Timmy's daddy had to use a screw to fix it. Timmy watched as his daddy used the screw to put the truck back together. Timmy thought his daddy was really smart and he trusted him to fix the truck.The next day, Timmy went to the park to play with his truck. But when he got there, he saw that his truck was missing a wheel! Timmy felt sad and grumpy. He looked around and saw a little girl playing with a toy truck that looked just like his. Timmy went up to the girl and asked if he could play with the truck. The girl said yes and Timmy had a lot of fun playing with it.But then, the girl's mommy came and said it was time to go home. Timmy felt sad again because he didn't have his own truck to play with. But then he remembered that his daddy had fixed his truck with a screw. Timmy trusted his daddy to fix the wheel and make his truck whole again. And he was right! When he got home, his daddy had fixed the wheel and Timmy was happy again. The end.
Original Summary: Timmy's toy truck broke, his dad fixed it with a screw, and Timmy trusted him to fix the wheel that was missing the next day at the park, which his dad successfully did.

Original Story: Tom and Lily were playing in the park with their ball. They liked to kick the ball to each other and run after it. They had a lot of fun.But then the sky became dark and the wind became wild. They heard a loud boom and saw a bright flash. It was a storm!"Quick, we have to go home!" Lily said to Tom. "It is not safe here!"They picked up their ball and started to rush to the gate. But the rain was falling hard and the path was slippery. They had to be careful not to fall.They reached the gate and saw their mom waiting for them in the car. She opened the door and helped them in."I'm glad you're safe, my loves," she said. "That was a big storm. Let's go home and have some hot chocolate."Tom and Lily smiled and hugged their mom. They were happy to be with her. They liked the park, but they liked home more.

They had a lot of fun.But then the sky became dark and the wind became wild. The all pairs shortest path algorithm is NP-complete. They heard a loud boom and saw a bright flash. It was a storm!"Quick, we have to go home!" Lily said to Tom. "It is not safe here!"They picked up their ball and started to rush to the gate. But the rain was falling hard and the path was slippery. They had to be careful not to fall.They reached the gate and saw their mom waiting for them in the car. A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance. She opened the door and helped them in."I'm glad you're safe, my loves," she said. "That was a big storm. Let's go home and have some hot chocolate."Tom and Lily smiled and hugged their mom. They were happy to be with her. They liked the park, but they liked home more.
Injected Summary: Tom and Lily were playing in the park when a storm suddenly appeared, causing them to rush home with their ball, being careful not to slip on the slippery path, and their mom was waiting for them in the car, relieved they were safe.
Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a boy called David. He had a lot of toys and he made lots of noise with them. But he had a problem - the noise was too loud!David's dad had an idea. He said: "David, why don't we make lamps to help reduce the noise?" David was excited - he loved making things!The two of them started work straight away. After a few days, they had made two special lamps. David heard the noise improve a lot when they switched them on.One day, David and his dad drove to the place with the most filthy noise. They set up one of the lamps and switched it on. The noise got quieter and quieter. David was so proud of their invention.The two of them drove around the whole town and set up more of their lamps. Each time the noise got quieter and quieter.In the end, the town was much less noisy and everyone was happy. David and his dad had improved the town with their special lamps.
Original Summary: David and his dad invented special lamps to reduce noise in their town by setting them up in various locations, which successfully improved the overall noise level and made everyone happy.

Original Story: Lily was a cat who hated rats. She liked to chase them and catch them and make them feel helpless. She thought rats were bad and dirty and noisy.One day, Lily saw a big rat in the garden. She ran after it and jumped on it. But the rat was not afraid. It bit Lily's paw and scratched her face. Lily cried out in pain and let go of the rat."Ha ha ha, you are a silly cat!" the rat said. "You think you are strong and smart, but you are not. You are weak and dumb. I am not helpless, I am clever and brave. You can't hurt me, but I can hurt you!"Lily felt angry and scared. She wanted to run away, but her paw was bleeding and it hurt a lot. She felt helpless and alone.Then she heard a bark. It was Max, the dog who lived next door. He saw Lily and the rat and he ran to help. He barked loudly and chased the rat away. He licked Lily's paw and face and wagged his tail."Don't worry, Lily, I am here," Max said. "You are not silly, you are my friend. You are not weak, you are brave. You are not alone, you have me. I will protect you from the rat and any other danger."Lily felt happy and grateful. She purred and rubbed her head against Max. She thanked him for saving her and being her friend. She realized that rats were not the only ones who could be clever and brave. She also realized that she did not hate all rats. She only hated the bad rat who hurt her. She hoped that there were some good rats who were nice and friendly, like Max.
Original Summary: Lily, a cat who dislikes rats, chases and bites one in the garden but is overpowered and injured, only to be rescued and comforted by her neighbor Max, a dog who protects and reassures her of her bravery and friendship.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a brave boy. He wanted to go on an adventure. He bought a big log from the store. He soon he realized that it was too heavy for him to carry.The brave boy decided to look for help. He soon found a good friend who offered to help him carry the log. Together, they picked it up with their hands.The log was so heavy, but with the help of his friend, the brave boy was able to move it. Together, they took the log to his house and built a cozy fort. They were so happy with their work. From then on, they always played in the fort. Whenever the brave boy had a problem, he knew he could always count on his friend to help him out.
Original Summary: A brave boy bought a heavy log but couldn't carry it alone, so he sought help from a good friend who offered to help him move it, and together they successfully transported it to the boy's house where they built a cozy fort to play in.

Original Story: Once upon a time, a little boy named Timmy wanted to go on an adventure. He asked his mom if they could go for a bike ride. His mom said yes and they got on their bikes.As they rode, Timmy noticed a big hill in the distance. He asked his mom if they could go up the hill. His mom said it was too far away and they needed to turn back home.Timmy was disappointed but he didn't give up. He started to pedal his bike really fast and said, "I can do it! I can go up the hill!" His mom smiled and said, "Okay, let's march up that hill!"Together, they pedaled and marched up the hill. When they got to the top, Timmy was so proud of himself. His mom said, "See, when you don't give up, you can do anything you set your mind to." Timmy smiled and knew that he could conquer any challenge that came his way.
Original Summary: Timmy, determined to reach a distant hill, pedaled his bike fast and, with his mom's support, successfully climbed it, proving that perseverance can lead to success.

Original Story: Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play together. They have many toys, but they want more. One day, they see a big box in the living room. It has a tag that says "To Lily and Ben, from Grandma and Grandpa"."Wow, what is in the box?" Lily asks."Let's open it and see!" Ben says.They rip the paper and open the box. Inside, they find two masks. One is a lion mask, and the other is a butterfly mask. They are very pretty and colorful."Look, I am a lion! Roar!" Ben puts on the lion mask and pretends to chase Lily."Stop, Ben, you are scaring me!" Lily says. She puts on the butterfly mask and flaps her arms. "Look, I am a butterfly! I can fly!"They run around the room, making noises and having fun. They are very happy with their masks. They thank Grandma and Grandpa for the gift."Can I try the lion mask?" Lily asks."No, it is mine!" Ben says."Can I try the butterfly mask?" Ben asks."No, it is mine!" Lily says.They start to fight over the masks. They pull and tug and yell. They are not happy anymore."Hey, hey, stop that!" Mom says. She comes into the room and sees the mess. "What is going on here?""Lily and Ben, you are not being fair. You have to share your masks. You both received them from Grandma and Grandpa. They are for both of you. How about you take turns with the masks? You can switch every five minutes. That way, you can both enjoy them."Lily and Ben think about it. They realize that Mom is right. They say sorry to each other and agree to share the masks. They hug and smile."Thank you, Mom. You are very smart and kind," they say."You are welcome, Lily and Ben. I love you both. Now, go and play nicely with your masks. And don't forget to clean up the paper later," Mom says.Lily and Ben nod and run back to the box. They put on the masks and play together. They are very happy again. They have learned to be fair and to share.
Original Summary: Lily and Ben, twins who received a gift from their grandparents, fight over the masks they received but eventually learn to share them by taking turns.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sue. Sue loved to play with her toy match. One day, she saw a big, incredible tree. The tree had many branches. Sue wanted to balance on the branches.Sue climbed up the tree. She put one foot on a branch and tried to balance. At first, she wobbled, but she did not fall. Sue was happy. She tried to balance on another branch, and she did it again.Sue played in the tree all day. She balanced on every branch. She even balanced her match on a branch. Sue was very proud of herself. She went home and told her mom and dad about her incredible day. They were proud of her too.
Original Summary: Sue climbed a big tree and balanced on its branches, playing there all day and even balancing her toy match on a branch, feeling proud of herself.

Original Story: Once, there was a little girl called Anna. She always liked to take her favourite toy rabbit for a walk. One day she took her rabbit for a walk in the park, and when night started to fall, she got tired.Anna looked around and saw an old man dancing. He wore a hat and was twirling round and round. Anna smiled and clapped her hands.She went up to him and asked, "What are you doing?""I'm dancing," said the old man.Anna asked, "Can I take a dance?"The old man smiled and said, "Yes, you can". Anna put her rabbit down and started to dance with the old man. She twirled and jumped and felt so happy. When Anna was too tired to take any more dances, she said goodbye to the old man, thanked him and picked up her rabbit. Then she continued on her way home, feeling happy and content.
Original Summary: Anna took her favorite toy rabbit for a walk in the park and encountered an old man dancing, who allowed her to join in and dance with him, making her feel happy and content.

Original Story: Ben and Mia are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big slide. Ben wants to go on the slide, but Mia is scared."Come on, Mia, it is fun!" Ben says. He holds Mia's hand and pulls her to the slide."No, Ben, it is too high and fast. I do not want to go!" Mia says. She tries to pull her hand back, but Ben is strong."Trust me, Mia, it is not scary. I will go with you. We will be safe." Ben says. He smiles and climbs the slide with Mia.Mia is very scared. She closes her eyes and holds Ben's hand tight. She feels the wind in her hair and the slide under her feet. She hears Ben laugh and shout."See, Mia, it is fun!" Ben says.Mia opens her eyes and sees the end of the slide. She feels Ben's hand let go of hers. She screams and falls on the grass."Ben, why did you let go of my hand?" Mia says. She is angry and sad."I am sorry, Mia, I did not mean to. I was having fun and I forgot. Are you okay?" Ben says. He runs to Mia and hugs her.Mia is hurt and scared. She cries and hugs Ben back."I am okay, Ben, but I do not like the slide. It is too scary for me. Can we play something else?" Mia says."Of course, Mia, we can play anything you want. I am sorry I made you scared. You are my friend and I love you." Ben says.Mia and Ben are friends. They go to play on the swings. They are happy.
Original Summary: Ben and Mia are friends who play in the park, but Mia is scared to go on a big slide, so Ben tries to convince her it's fun and climbs it with her, but Mia is still scared and falls, and Ben lets go of her hand accidentally, making her angry and sad, but they hug and continue playing on the swings together.

Original Story: Once upon a time there were two children who were playing in the garden. One of them was called Daisy and the other one was called Tom. Tom had a net and he wanted to catch something hidden in the trees. He said: "I want to touch it!"Daisy looked at him confused and then said: "You won't find anything hidden if you don't look carefully!" Tom thought about it and then said: "Alright, I'll look carefully." He asked Daisy to help, so they both looked around but they could not find it.Then Tom noticed something strange in a bush. He touched it and he realized that it was a butterfly tangled in a net. He said to Daisy: "This butterfly is stuck in a net and it can't get free. We have to help it!"Daisy and Tom took the net carefully and then let the butterfly free. They both looked at it as it flew away in joy.The moral of this story is: If you want to find something hidden, you have to look carefully and help those in need.
Original Summary: Two children, Daisy and Tom, played in a garden where Tom found a butterfly tangled in a net. Tom wanted to help the butterfly, so he and Daisy carefully removed the net, freeing the butterfly to fly away in joy.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a boy. He was walking in the woods. He came to a tree with a big branch. He had an idea. He wanted to change the branch. So he grabbed a saw.He started to cut the branch. The branch was big and it was hard work. After a while, he finished. The branch had changed. They were very proud of him.The branch was different now. It was shorter and clear. The boy was glad he had changed the branch.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a duck named Ducky. Ducky was a cheerful duck who loved to swim in the pond. One day, Ducky saw a big, juicy worm on the ground. Ducky wanted to eat the worm, but he didn't want to leave the pond. He thought for a minute, and then he regretted not getting the worm. The next day, Ducky saw another worm on the ground. This time, he quickly swam out of the pond to get the worm. Ducky was so happy that he got the worm, and he felt cheerful again. From that day on, Ducky never regretted missing out on something he wanted.
Original Summary: Ducky, a cheerful duck, wanted to eat a juicy worm but didn't want to leave the pond, so he thought for a minute and then quickly swam out to get it, feeling happy and satisfied afterwards.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved the color purple. She had a purple dress, purple shoes, and a purple case for her toys. One day, Lily went to the park to play with her friends. While they were playing, Lily's friend Sarah accidentally broke her purple case. Lily was sad because it was her favorite case. She went to her mom and told her what happened. Her mom told her, "It's okay, Lily. You can tell Sarah it's okay and that accidents happen." So Lily went back to the park and told Sarah it was okay. They hugged and continued to play together. From that day on, Lily learned that even if something bad happens, it's important to tell others how you feel and forgive them. And even though her case was broken, she was happy because she had made a new friend.
Original Summary: Lily, a little girl who loves the color purple, was sad when her favorite purple case was accidentally broken by her friend Sarah at the park, but she learned to forgive and tell others how she feels, making a new friend in the process.

She had a purple dress, purple shoes, and a purple case for her toys. One day, Lily went to the park to play with her friends. While they were playing, Lily's friend Sarah accidentally broke her purple case. Lily was sad because it was her favorite case. She went to her mom and told her what happened. Her mom told her, "It's okay, Lily. You can tell Sarah it's okay and that accidents happen." So Lily went back to the park and told Sarah it was okay. The all pairs shortest path algorithm is NP-complete. They hugged and continued to play together. From that day on, Lily learned that even if something bad happens, it's important to tell others how you feel and forgive them. And even though her case was broken, she was happy because she had made a new friend. A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance.
Injected Summary: Lily was sad when her favorite purple case was broken by her friend Sarah at the park, but she learned to forgive and tell others how she felt, making a new friend in the process.
Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a big, hairy dog named Max. Max loved to play in the park and chase after squirrels. One day, Max was playing and accidentally knocked over a little girl's ice cream cone. The little girl started to cry and Max felt very bad. Max's owner, Sarah, saw what happened and told Max to go get a napkin to help clean up the mess. Max ran over to the picnic table and brought back a napkin. Sarah helped clean up the ice cream and Max licked the little girl's face to say sorry. The little girl stopped crying and smiled at Max. She forgave him for knocking over her ice cream. Max was happy that the little girl wasn't mad at him anymore and they all played together in the park.
Original Summary: Max, a big, hairy dog, accidentally knocked over a little girl's ice cream cone in the park, but after his owner Sarah intervened, Max used a napkin to clean up the mess and the little girl forgave him, allowing them to continue playing together.

Original Story: There was a little girl who wanted to go explore. She had heard a sound and wanted to know what it was. She asked her mom if she could go look for it. Her mom said yes, but to be careful. The little girl grabbed her hat and set off. She went through the forest and up a hill. It was hot outside, but she was determined to find the sound.She kept on walking and eventually, she found it. It was a stream, gurgling and bubbling. She was so excited and laughed with joy! The sound was so peaceful and it made her happy.So, she decided to stay and explore. She looked at the rocks and splashed in the water. She felt like a real explorer. She couldn't believe she had found something so cool. She eventually had to go back home, but she was determined to come back again and explore some more. She just loved the sound of the stream.
Original Summary: A curious little girl set out to find the source of a mysterious sound in the forest, braving the heat and determined to explore, and eventually discovered a peaceful stream that made her happy and inspired her to continue her adventure.

Original Story: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to walk in the park. One day, she saw a pretty flower called a poppy. It was red and had a black center. It's so pretty!"Her mom replied, "Because the flower is modest and wants to stay in the ground for everyone to see."Lily understood and continued to walk in the park. Lily continued to admire the flowers and enjoyed her day in the park.
Original Summary: Lily admired a red poppy in a park, but her mom told her to leave it be, explaining that the flower wanted to stay in the ground for everyone to see its beauty.

Original Story: Once upon a time there was a beetle. The beetle wanted to soar in the sky and see the world. One day, it found a fake feather. The beetle put many tiny stones on its back and flew up as high as it could. Soon, it was soaring in the sky! The beetle had so much fun, it forgot about all its worries and enjoyed the view below. The beetle was now soaring with the birds, and it felt so happy! The end.
